Chantal runs a stall selling cloth and other sewing materials. This loan will enable her to purchase bolts of cloth from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Chantal’s strongest point as an entrepreneur is her rigor in finances and accounting. Her aim in the long term is to strengthen and diversify her business.

loans.use: To purchase bolts of cloth for resale

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a single woman who lives at a rental house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling retail, to her neighbours and passersby. 

In addition, Josephine operates a shoes selling business which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of opening more businesses in the future.

With a loan of KES 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Josefa trabaja en servicio de transporte, pues tiene una unidad de taxi y un recorrido escolar, trabajo que logro gracias a su ahorro y su préstamo en Afodenic, en donde logro dar mejor mantenimiento a sus vehículos.
Junto a su esposo labora ya que el conduce la unidad, lo que es de gran beneficio para la economía familiar. 
Hoy con este nuevo financiamiento será para la reparación de su taxi el cual le ha dado problema para dar su servicio, ya que tiene  varias piezas que cambiar como: juego de rotulas, raquis, bolineras de patente delantera, juego de viela, juego de anillos, batería, carburador a si como la mano de obra. 
Para ella de grandes beneficios este préstamo ya que facilitan el trabajo. para un bienestar común.
texts.en:
Josefa works providing transportation because she owns a taxi and a school route.  She attained this work thanks to her savings and her Afodenic loan which made it possible for her to repair her vehicles.  She works alongside her husband who drives the vehicle; this is of great benefit for the family economy.

Today’s new loan will be used to repair the taxi, which has been causing her some problems in providing the service, because it has several parts that need to be replaced like: suspension ball joints, ball bearings, piston rods, rings, battery, carburetor and to pay labor costs.

For her, this loan will be of great benefit because it will make her work easier for their common good.

loans.use: to replace damaged parts in her taxi so that she can keep working.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem lives in a small city of Punjab, Pakistan called Kasur. it is known for its leather industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family in the area of Azher colony for many years. 

She is a housewife and prefers staying at home doing household work. She is an active lady and also supports her husband in his business in her spare time. Her husband is a cobbler by profession and makes shoes on order. This is his family business because his three sons and a daughter are also attached to the same business. They receive orders from different shoe-manufacturing factories and shoes selling shops and fulfil them on time to earn profit. Collectively they are able to support their household very well. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. Through the loan, her husband will buy leather, nails, shoe-polisher and glue, etc. in bulk to be able to fulfill orders on time and make larger profits. 

Her husband has been involved in this business for the past seven years and Naseem is very confident that an investment will help him make more profits and sales. 

She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

loans.use: To buy leather, nails, shoe-polisher & glue for shoe making business

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has practiced potato farming in Olkalou town for the last 9 years. She sells all her produce in the local market, at retail prices. She is 53 years old and a single mother of 5 school-aged children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds, fertilizer and pay her casual workers.

In the future, Esther is planning to practice mixed farming and has become a leading supplier of milk in Olkalou town.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and to pay casual workers.

loans.name: Martha Beatriz

texts.es:
Martha, se dedica a la venta D. mariscos, vive con su nieto, un sobrino, ella tiene dos años D. estar en el negocio, venD. mariscos variados, camarones, pescado, langostas y filetes.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. mariscos, ya que tiene no tiene lo suficiente en fondos para comprar la mercadería, su compra es al por mayor, en pescado D. diferentes clases, langostas, filetes, camarones, calamar, entre otras especies.
Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar las ventas, manteniendo el negocio fuerte, para generar más ganancias y mejorar la  condición D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Martha sells seafood. She lives with her grandson and a nephew. She has been in this business for two years, selling a variety of seafood - shrimp, fish, lobsters, and fillets.

She is requesting this loan to purchase seafood since she does not have sufficient funds to purchase merchandise. She buys wholesale various types of fish, lobsters, fillets, shrimp, squid, and other species.

This investment will help her improve her sales, maintaining a strong business in order to generate more revenue and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase seafood: lobsters, fillets, shrimp, squid, and fish

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr. Mario es una persona, que junto con su distinguida esposa atienden su negocio el cual ya  tiene ocho  años operando,  en esta  ocasión  ellos   requieren de  nuestra  ayuda  porque  desean  invertir  en su local  y  obtener  la posibilidad  de  brindar  una  mayor  variedad  de  productos  a sus  clientes asi  como un excelente  servicio  y  esto  les permitirá  obtener  mayores ingresos  para  seguir ofreciendo a  su   familia  una  excelente  calidad   de   vida.
texts.en: Together with his distinguished wife, Mario works in his business which he has been running for eight years.  On this occasion, he and his wife need our help because they would like to invest in their store and have the possibility of providing their customers with a greater variety of products, as well as excellent service.  This will allow them to make more income so that they can continue offering their family an excellent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Kunthy

texts.en:
Kunthy (shown in the photo), 48, and her husband, Sok, 40, are fishermen and rice farmers. They live along National Road number five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have two sons and one daughter. Two are garment workers and another one is married and lives in separate home.

Kunthy is asking for a loan of $600 to fill-up the land of her house foundation and to bury a highway drainage pipe because the house where she lives needs a more functional water system.

loans.use: to fill-up the land of her house foundation and to bury a highway drainage pipe because she needs to arrange a more functional water system for her house.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 28 years old and married to Jane.

He has been running his cereals shop business for the past eight years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 40,000 that he uses to take care of his family and pump back into the business.

He has been loaned KES 30,000 by KADET Ltd. He intends to use the loan to purchase more stock such as wheat flour, rice, maize, beans and peas in bulk.

He plans to use the anticipated profit to open another cereals shop.

In the future, he hopes to open a mill.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as wheat flour, rice, maize, beans and peas in bulk.

loans.name: Kwamé

texts.fr:
Kwamé est un homme âgé de 23 ans. Il est célibataire 
Kwamé travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il vend à domicile à toutes personnes et achète à BADJA.
 Kwamé a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de mais.
texts.en:
Kwamé is a 23 year old man.  He is single.
Kwamé has been working as a salesman since 2010.  He sells to people from his home and buys his supplies in Badja.
He is requesting his first loan through WAGES in order to buy sacks of corn.


Kwamé est un homme âgé de 23 ans. Il est célibataire 
Kwamé travaille comme revendeur depuis 2010. Il vend à domicile à toutes personnes et achète à BADJA.
 Kwamé a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sacs de mais.

loans.use: to buy sacks of corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire extra palm fruits to process to make more sales.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 44 years old and married to a woman named Ann. They are blessed with three children.  He has been running a restaurant for the past six years with the monthly income of KES 22,000 which he uses to support his family needs.

He is applying for his first loan of KES 80,000 from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  He will use the loan to buy cooking fat, rice, and sugar for his restaurant. 

With the anticipated profit, he will expand his business.  His hope and dream is to be successful.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, rice and sugar for his restaurant

loans.name: Tamufor

texts.en:
He was born in June 1967 and is married with seven kids. Three of these children are under fifteen years of age. He lives with his family in a two-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. The major challenges he has faced in life have been the death of his father, the failure of his son in the ordinary-level Government Certificate Exams, the difficulty to pay his children’s school fees and the sudden death of two of his pigs.
 
He joined GHAPE in 2009. He invested his last loan in his pig business and used the proceeds to educate his children and to buy zinc and nails to complete his house. He plans to invest this loan in his electronics shop, to buy cables, bulbs and plugs. He believes that this business will be successful because he is selling very good quality cables and other materials that his customers will like.

With the proceeds from this loan, he will pay his children’s school fees and furnish his house. He prefers a GHAPE loan because of the low interest rates, the education GHAPE offers its members, and because the loan is repaid in payments.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community in its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase cables, sockets and electric tools.

loans.name: Busyhands Group

texts.en:
Yvonne is 42 years old and lives in Gweru. She is married and her husband is a driver. They have three children aged  21, 19 and 13 and all of them go to school. They also look after four further dependants.

She sells clothing and electrical goods in a nearby market and employs two people. They also have income from her husband's salary and from farming.  Yvonne faces a number of challenges in her business including competition, high levels of import duty and late payments from customers.

She will use the money she borrows to buy jackets, televisions, speakers and generators.

Yvonne hope that her business will continue to expand enabling her to pay school fees, buy household items and food and generally improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To buy jackets, televisions, speakers and generators for resale

loans.name: Moris

texts.en:
Moris is a single man who lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

For the past two years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passers-by. He faces a major challenge from the seasonality of his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000, he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar

loans.name: Thary

texts.en:
Thary, 40 years old, is a farmer and tailor earning $1 per day.  Her husband is a motor taxi driver earning $6 per day.  They have four children; one is studying, two more are working in the factory.  Each earns $3 per day, and one more is only five years old.  Every month, Thary has to spend $60 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on school fees, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses.  

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy pigs to feed and sell.  She wants to feed more pigs S. she can get a better income.

loans.use: to buy pigs to feed and sell.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 45 years old. She is married and has five children. 

Gilda is in the business of vending vegetables and spices such as black pepper, onions, garlic, and vinegar. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy more vegetables and spices such as onions, garlic, black pepper, and vinegar.

Gilda joined as a member of HSPFI in the year 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits, vegetables, and spices intended for sale.

loans.name: Lais

texts.es: Lais, de 21 años, es una joven emprendedora, buena, amable y muy responsable. Aún es soltera y vive en casa de su madre. Ella es un apoyo muy importante en su familia ya que siempre esta en constante aporte a la economía del hogar y esto permite que su familia tenga mejores ingresos y así tener una mejor calidad de vida. Lais tiene un trabajo muy bueno, ell se dedica a la venta de variada mercadería, como zapatos, ropa, accesorios de mujer, etc. De ahí ella se encarga de vender a sus vecinos, familiares y amigos. Toda esta actividad lo realiza en su casa desde hace 2 años y lo hace sola. Al principio Lais tuvo muchos obstáculos como el factor económico y otros más, pero se las ingenio para poder conseguir una cantidad minima con la cual pudo empezar. Hoy éste trabajo le permite disponer de su horario, así como aportar a su hogar, pues gana el 50% de su inversión. Ella como todo joven tiene muchas metas y objetivos, como el de incursionar en la crianza de pollos ya que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y es cuando su precio es mas elevado y tiene más salida. Este será el segundo préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará mercadería para seguir con la venta, además empezará a criar pollo, por ello comprará pollitos, alimentos y algunos materiales para armar su galpon.
texts.en:
21-year-old Lais is an entrepreneurial, good, kind and very responsible young woman.  She is still single and lives in her mother's house.  She is a very important source of support for her family as she always contributes towards the household financially which enables her family to enjoy better income and, consequently, a better quality of life.

Lais has a very good business.  She sells a variety of merchandise such as shoes, clothes, ladies' accessories, etc.  She sells to her neighbors, family members and friends.  She has been running this business from home for two years and works alone.  At first, Lais experienced a lot of difficulties such as the economic factor and others.  However, she managed to obtain a minimum quantity of goods with which she could start working.  Today this work allows her to set her own hours and contribute to her household as she earns 50% on what she invests.  Like every young person, Lais has many goals and aims.  One of these is to start a business raising chickens as the end-of-year holiday season is approaching and this is when the price is highest and there is a lot of opportunity.

This will be Lais' second loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can continue reaching her goals.  For her part, she pledges once again to make her repayments on time.  Lais will use the sum she has requested to buy merchandise to sell.  She will also start raising chickens and, for this, she will buy chicks, feed and some materials to build a chicken shed.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes.  She will also buy chicks, feed and materials for building a chicken shed

loans.name: Tariel

texts.en:
Tariel is from the village of Chikaani, East Georgia. He is 47 years old and lives with his family: wife, a daughter, a son and mother in law. The children go to school. Tareiel is a war veteran. He has health problems and receives a monthly pension from the state. He runs the family farm. They have four milk cows and sell an average of 50 kg. of cheese every month on the on local market. The family also has two pigs and sells 22-24 piglets per year. Tariel also grows corn on the family-owned plot of land. Most of the corn is used for feeding the domestic animals. The rest is sold locally. 

Tariel has requested credit to purchase two milk cows. He will produce and sell 50% more cheese. It will increase the profit of the family farm. He plans to use the profit for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 28-year-old, hardworking, single business man. For the last eight years, he has been running a grocery business to make a living. He has employed one person to assist him in managing the business. James has been able to retain his business because of his good reputation with his customers. 

James is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy tomatoes and potatoes for resale. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a twenty-nine-year-old married woman with two children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is a teacher by profession and has been teaching for five years.

In order to supplement her meager salary, she decided to set up a canteen. Her family dream is to build a permanent house to live in, and her business dream is to increase her stock. Sarah needs the loan to buy soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap and sugar to sell in the school canteen.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 42 years old and is married to John. They have one child.

She has been in the retail business for the last 4 years, from which she earns a monthly income of Kes 20,000. She is applying for her first loan of Kes 10,000. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer.

She hopes to use the funds to buy more motorbike spare parts and secondhand clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts and secondhand clothes for sale

loans.name: Ajur

texts.en:
Ajur is a 33-year-old married woman with six children: three of them are in school. She has run a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.
Ajur is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: " Keur Demba Kahone" Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit » Keur Demba Kahone », situé dans un petit village au centre du Sénégal, rassemble cinq femmes qui s’activent dans l’agriculture depuis des années. La dame Debbo est la présidente, elle est la plus âgée et se trouve au milieu sur la photo. Avec le crédit qu’elle sollicite, elle va acheter des semences et de l’engrais et donner à son mari pour l’exploitation de leur champ. 
En plus de l’agriculture, Debbo fait de l’élevage d’ovins et de bovins et grâce aux revenus de ces deux activités, elle nourrit sa famille.
Ce qui lui reste dans sa vie, est d’assurer l’avenir de ses enfants et puisse qu’ils ne connaissent que la terre depuis leurs  ancêtres, elle a inculqué en eux cette culture et veille à ce qu’ils puissent l’exercer sans obstacles majeurs : là est son projet.

loans.use: acheter des semences et de l'engrais pour la campagne agricole

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary Wamalwa is 45 years old, married and blessed with six children age 24, 21, 17, 15, 11, and 8. She is a business woman and she has been in business for three years. Right now her monthly income is KES 3,000. 

She is borrowing a loan of KES 30,000 to boost her business, and she will use the anticipated profit from the business to stock more goods for her business. This is her second loan. She paid her previous loan successfully. Her hope is to have a good life and a successful future.

loans.use: To boost her business.

loans.name: Shadia's Group

texts.en:
Shadia is a member of this group from Iraq. Shadia is 56 years old widow, mother of one  . She is one of the many entrepreneur Iraqi women that started their own business to meet the financial needs of their families.
She has five years of experience with her sewing business activity .When she heard about Izdiharona's qard hassan product (without interest) for widow women she took a loan to buy sewing machine ,fabric and over sewing machine to increase her products.
She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits by open big factory and hire jobless women.
They preferred to blur their face for cultural reason.

loans.use: A portion of Shadia's Group's $ 3,000 loan helps a member to buy sewing machine ,fabric and over sewing machine.

loans.name: Super Femmes 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SUPER FEMMES 1 est composé de dix personnes qui sont dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Akouavi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo, n'a pas fréquentée l’école. Akouavi est âgée de 68 ans et vit au Bénin. Akouavi est veuve et mère de quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux à sa charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par la bénéficiaire. Pour cette raison, Akouavi vend depuis quarante ans divers produits et des boissons locales. Akouavi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Akouavi ensemble avec les membres du groupe SUPER FEMMES 1, sollicite un premier crédit.

loans.use: Acheter divers produits et des boissons locales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farming inputs.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is married with three young children in primary school. He has no formal training, having left school at an early age because his family could not pay the fees. He comes from a humble peasant family from the central part of Kenya. He started a small business selling new clothes at the border (Malaba) and has been able to slowly grow. He received his first loan from PEMCI to expand his retail shop and he successfully repaid the loan.

With this second loan he plans to expand his shop into both a retail and wholesale outlet. He also intends to diversify by offering cosmetic products. With continuously increasing capital, he plans to purchase stock directly from the factory. This will reduce his expense and he will be able to become a supplier in the area.

With his business, Peter is able to provide clothing to the community at an affordable price. He has also been able to bring products closer to other small business people. This enables them to save on transportation costs of having to go to the city for restocking. Mr. G. supports an orphanage with over 60 children in his home community in Central province. Within Malaba he is an active member of his church, supporting various church activities in the community.

He is a very hard working gentlemen who has repaid his loan with PEMCI timely. He is worth supporting.

loans.use: To improve his clothing business

loans.name: Lucia Angela

texts.en:
Lucia is 22 years old and has 2 children. Her husband and her have a small lot where they grow a great variety of vegetables: chayote, lettuce, radish, cabbage, etc. They then sell the produce nearby the markets in the city. With the loan, they'll be able buy fertilizers and products to control weeds that affect their crops. Lucia and her husband would thus have better vegetables to offer. They belong to the group Palmas 1.

Translated from Spanish by Isabel Tan, a Kiva volunteer.

LUCIA TIENE 22 AÑOS , CASADA , DOS HIJOS , ELLA Y SU ESPOSO POSEEN UN PEQUEÑO TERRENO EN EL CUAL SE DEDICAN AL CULTIVO DE LAS VERDURAS : CHAYOTES, LECHUGAS, RABANOS, REPOLLOS, ETC. LAS CUALES POSTERIORMENTE LAS SALEN A VENDER A LA CIUDAD EN LAS CERCANIAS DEL MERCADO A LAS PERSONAS QUE AHI HABITAN . CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE INVERTIR EN FERTILIZANTES Y LIQUIDOS QUE EXTERMINAN LAS MALAS HIERBAS QUE AFECTAN A LA COSECHA. Y AYUDAR A TENER MEJORES CULTIVOS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO PALMAS 1.

loans.use: VENTA DE VERDURAS

loans.name: Gulare

texts.en: Gulare A. owns and operates a small stand in a bazaar located in Khachmaz, Azerbaijan where she currently sells many different types of sandals. Gulare has already successfully paid back a loan from Norwegian Microredit showing herself to be a reliable customer. Gulare is looking for funding once again so that she can increase and diversify the inventory of her small stand.

loans.use: To increase  the quantity and variety of her sandal inventory.

loans.name: Srun

texts.en: Mrs. Srun L., 61, is a mother of two children and lives with her husband ( pictured because Srun L. is unavailable) in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She runs a store at home selling grocery products to the people in her area and typically earns up to $12/day in revenue. Her husband, 63, has retired from his job and two of her children work as waitresses, together earning $60 per month. This loan is to be used to expand her inventory by adding more grocery products to meet her growing customer demand and the remainder of the money is to be used to repair her house.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more grocery products to meet her growing customer demand. The remainder of the money is to be used to repair her house.

loans.name: Kim-Oeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Kim-oeurn C. was married in 1985 and has 5 children, 4 sons and 1 daughter. He learnt to repair radios, TVs and tape recorders after he married, and he started his business repairing radios, TVs and tape recorders in 1986. His wife brings in additional income selling Chinese noodles and coffee from their house. Neither husband nor wife finished primary school. With the income from their businesses however, the couple are able to send all of their children to school.

This is the first time Kim-Oueurn C. has asked for a loan from MAXIMA. He has asked for this $300 in order to purchase more music tools and materials so that he can expand his business repairing radios, TVs, and tape recorders.

loans.use: to purchase more tools and materials in order to expand his business

loans.name: Elisa Marcela

texts.es:
Elisa Marcela O. L. is 53 years old and was born in the city of Bluefields, Nicaragua. She is a single mother of six grown children, and she has 2 grandchildren ages 2 and 4. Mrs. O. has more than 35 years of experience selling fruits and vegetables, and her clients are families, restaurant owners, grocery store managers, and public institutions that prefer her variety of fruits and vegetables. Mrs. O. needs to buy 200 units of bananas at $0.22 cents per unit, 100 units of cabbage at $1.44 dollars per unit, 2 boxes of tomatoes at $27.00 dollars per box, and 2 quintals (200 kilograms) of potatoes at $54 dollars per quintal (per 100 kilograms). With this loan she will be able to satisfy the demand of the public institutions and families that seek her business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Elisa Marcela O. L. tiene 53 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Bluefields, es madre soltera de 6 hijos mayores de edad, a su cargo tiene 2 nietas de 2 y 4 años de edad. La Sra. O. tiene más de 35 años de experiencia vendiendo frutas y vegetales, sus clientes son los padres de familia, dueños de comedores, dueños de pulperías y las instituciones públicas que la prefieren por tener variedad de verduras y frutas. La Sra. O. necesita comprar 200 unidades de plátanos a $0.22 centavos dólar la unidad, 100 unidades de repollo a $ 1.44 dólar cada unidad de repollo, 2 cajas de tomates a $ 27.00 dólar cada caja y 2qq de papa a $54.00 dólar cada quintal, con esta inversión podrá satisfacer la demanda de las instituciones públicas y los padres de familia.

loans.use: To buy bananas, potatoes, tomatoes and cabbage

loans.name: Kamuli B1 (A) Group

texts.en: Joy is currently 32 years old. She owns a small drug shop that sells medicine. Joy would like to apply for a loan to use the extra business and profit to begin a clinic. She hopes that the clinic will be able to serve a wider range of patients and provide greater healthcare to her patrons.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine

loans.name: Wahidallah

texts.en: Wahidallah lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He was still a young boy when his father died. He is supporting his mother while he is still in school, working part-time in his photocopy shop. He is requesting an individual loan to buy a new photocopy machine and also to complete other necessary business materials so that he can make a good income to help his mother and also make a better future for himself. He is happy to be able to further his business.

loans.use: To buy a new photocopy machine

loans.name: Marleny Yanet

texts.es:
For the last 3 years, Marleny has been a part of “Banco Comunal “Rikchariy””, which means “Wake Up” in Quechua. Marleny is a 30 year-old single mother of a 7 year-old daughter. She sells vegetables and seasoning at a stand at the central market in the town of Ayucucho. She also peddles candy and sweets at the city plaza of Ayacucho until very late at night.

Marleny requests a loan of 3000 soles ($1,050) to be spent on the purchase of cigarettes, gum, candy, lollipops, soy sauce, vinegar, cumin, and pepper. Her savings will be spent on building her home and the education of her daughter. Marleny’s dream is for her daughter to become a professional, for her business to grow and to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Marleny pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rikchariy” que significa “Despiértate” en quechua, hace 3 años. Marleny es madre soltera, tiene 30 años y 1 hija de 7 años. Marleny vende verduras y condimentos en un puesto del mercado central de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Marleny vende golosinas de manera ambulatoria en la plaza de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza hasta altas horas de la noche.

Marleny necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cigarro, chicle, caramelos, chupetines, sillao, vinagre, comino, pimienta. Sus ahorros son para construir su casa y la educación de su hija. Los sueños de Marleny son que su hija sea profesional, su negocio crezca y la construcción de su casa.

loans.use: To purchase cigarettes, gum, candy, lollipops, soy sauce, vinegar, cumin, and pepper to make a business grow.

loans.name: Salelologa Sapulu Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
For these 8 women of Salelologa Sapulu on the island of Savaii, these are their first loans from SPBD. They all undertook 4 weeks of training on managing a business and maintaining a savings account, and then passed a written test on the SPBD principles: business, savings, weekly meetings, payments and group guarantee. Over the next 52 weeks, they will support each other in their individual business development and to guarantee on-time payments.

The women will use their loans for the following purposes:

Faimafili M. (44, married, 11 children) to purchase a fishing boat, a fishing net, goggles, and a spear for her fish business.

Iutita S. (28, married) to purchase a sewing machine for her clothing business.

Eseta S. (29, married, 2 children) to purchase a cooler, a box of cups, pesticides, a bag of sugar, and candy for her ice cake (ice cream) business.

Alofa T. M. (30, married, 3 children) to purchase timber, iron roofing, and cement to build her barber shop.

Sialia T. F. (59, married, 4 children) to purchase oil, a gas oven, large pots, and plastic cups for her popcorn and clothing businesses.

Fualole A. (26, married, 1 child) to purchase concentrate, sugar, plastic cups, candy, and a cooler for her ice cake business.

Faoliu M S. (43, single, 2 children) to purchase an oven, flour, sugar, pork, and other items for her pork and bread business.

Panou M. (47, married, 5 children) to purchase sugar, flour, butter, eggs, yeast, and cement and timber to build her bakery which sells donuts, pork cakes and bread.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for fishing, sewing, and other businesses

loans.name: Jose Arnulfo

texts.es:
Arnulfo got involved in this line of business when he was very young. It has been the family's business. His parents dedicated themselves to the pottery business trade which he later inherited. He has kept the family's tradition alive. He is still involved because it provides a source of income for his family. The neighborhood where he lives has a high concentration of pottery shops. He started thirty years ago by selling hand-made pottery to neighboring communities. Currently, there are orders being made from places such as, San Luis Potosi and Poza Rica Veracruz. His business is growing and needs more investment.

He is requesting a credit line in the amount of US$625.00, which will be repaid in 6 months. It will be used to purchase more material used in manufacturing the hand-made pieces. Also, more clients and orders are coming in which require more investment as well.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Arnulfo inició el negocio desde muy pequeño, empezó primero como un negocio familiar, sus padres se dedicaron al negocio de alfarería el cual heredo y hasta la fecha continua con la tradición familiar, actualmente continua porque de ahí obtiene ingresos familiares, de hecho en la comunidad en la que vive la mayoría son talleres de alfarería. Comenzó hace 30 años fabricando artesanías vendiéndolas en las comunidades cercanas, actualmente surte pedidos a San Luis Potosí y Poza Rica Veracruz, y como su negocio va en crecimiento tiene la necesidad de hacer mayor inversión.

Solicita un crédito por US $625 que pagara en 6 meses para surtir material para la fabricación de las artesanías, actualmente ha ampliado su cartera de clientes y tiene mayores pedidos, por lo que requiero de más inversión

loans.use: Purchase material for work.

loans.name: Khea

texts.en: Mrs. Khea S. is 30 and is a clothes seller in the local market in Sala Khom Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Previously, Mrs. Khea S. obtained a loan from AMK to start her clothing-selling business. Her business now is improved, so she wants to expand her business; unfortunately, Mrs. Khea S. has insufficient money to buy fashionable clothes to sell to her customers. Thus, Mrs. Khea S. decided to ask for a loan to buy them in order to resell, as well as to improve her standard of living. Her husband, Mr. Mano Khouk, is a motorcycle-taxi driver. Mrs. Khea S. has two children; both of them are attending school. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fashionable clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Martine

texts.fr:
Martine K. was born on April 7, 1973 in COTONOU. Married to Nicéphore KOGBETO, a printer by trade, she is a trained seamstress. She has two children: Ornella (age 13) is in 7th grade, and Mariano (age 8) is in 3rd grade. Besides her sewing business, she has been selling a variety of goods for ten years. Because of her teeming customers, she finds herself compelled to increase her inventory of various goods, and so she is requesting a loan capable of meeting her customers' demands. She is on her fourth loan with our institution and always makes her payments.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Dame K. Martine est née le 07/04/1973 à COTONOU. Epouse de AKOGBETO Nicéphore imprimeur de son état, elle est couturière de formation. Elle est mère de deux enfants Ornella 13 ans en classe de cinquième et Mariano 8ans en classe de CE2. En dehors de son activité de couture elle vend divers produits et ceci depuis 10 ans. A cause de l’affluence de ses clients, elle se retrouve dans l’obligation d’augmenter son stock de produits divers d’où elle sollicite un crédit pouvant lui permettre de satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Elle est à son quatrième crédit dans notre institution et rembourse toujours bien.

loans.use: To buy 10 boxes of milk, 5 bags of pasta, 20 bars of soap, and 1 sack of ordinary rice

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.ru:
Ahmadjon R. lives in the area of Khuroson. He is involved in agricultural business. He buys and resells large-horned cattle. He has been involved in this type of business for five years. He wants to increase his commodity circulation and wants to receive a loan. This will help him receive more revenue which is vital for his large family of eight children. He plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Рабиев Ахмаджон проживает в районе Хуросон. Занимается бизнесом в сфере животноводства. Покупает и перепродает крупно-рогатый скот.Занимается данным видом бизнеса уже 5 лет.Хочет увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита . Это поможет получить дополнительную прибыль необходимую для его большой семьи. Ведь у него 8 детей. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of KPC

loans.name: Biova Group

texts.fr:
L’association BIOVA est un groupe de solidarité crée par deux femmes dynamiques dans le quartier d’Agoè. Ces femmes exercent des activités commerciales différemment. La première vend la boisson locale et la seconde est une coiffeuse et vend aussi des produits de beauté. 
Elles ont une fois bénéficié du crédit et on bien remboursé. Ce second crédit que cette association sollicite lui permettra de s’approvisionner avec 3 bidons de boisson locale et trois cartons de neutralisant et de produits de beauté.
texts.en:
The BIOVA association is a joint group created by two dynamic women in the Agoè district. These women run different commercial activities. The first sells local drinks and the second is a hairstylist and also sells cosmetics. They have already benefited from one loan and repaid it without incident. This second loan that this association is asking for will allow them to supply themselves with 3 bottles of local drinks and 3 boxes of neutralizing shampoo and cosmetics.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy three bottles of local Sodabi drinks and cosmetics

loans.name: Têko

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Têko est né le 31 décembre 1984 à Lomé. Il est célibataire et a pour activité la vente des cartes de recharge. Avec un an d’expérience dans ce domaine, il compte y évoluer dedans. 
Son activité consiste à acheter auprès des compagnies téléphoniques nationales (Togocel, Togotélécom et Moov) afin de vendre à ceux qui ont ouvert les cabines téléphoniques au bord des routes.
Pour palier aux difficultés financières qu’il rencontre dans l’exercice de son activité, il sollicite ce premier crédit pour 6 cartons de cartes de recharge.
texts.en:
Mr. Têko A. was born on December 31, 1984 in Lomé. He's unmarried and his business consists in selling recharge phone cards. With one year of experience in this field, he wants to evolve in it. His business consists in buying cards from large national phone companies (Togocel, Togotélécom and Moov), and in reselling them to those who opened phone booths on the sides of the roads. To overcome the financial difficulties he encountered in his business, he's seeking this first loan to buy 6 boxes of recharge phone cards.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy recharge phone cards

loans.name: Banco Florecer Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal, esta conformado por 17 integrantes, pertenece al municipio D. la Guardia, con su punto D. reunion ubicadoen el Km 9, Barrio 23 D. diciembre, del municipio D. El Torno, Santa Cruz, Bolivia. Este grupo tiene en común la producción D. D. alimentos y la venta D. comida. Y la mayoría son vecinas del barrio.
ZULEMA D., Es la líder del grupo, vive en el Km. 9 Barrio 23 D. diciembre del municipio del Torno, vive en la casa D. sus padres, con su esposo, tienen cuatro hijos. Su Actividad es la venta D. comida que realiza en forma ambulante, y el crédito que necesita será para invertir en el mismo negocio, aumentando su capital D. trabajo. Y con el ahorro que vaya acumulando en el banco comunal con el tiempo, quiere colocar una tiendita en su barrio.
MIREYA RIOS, Es la secretaria del banco comunal, vive en el Km. 9 Barrio 23 diciembre en la misma zona. Ella venD. frutas en el mercado y también se dedica a la venta D. cosméticos  vive en casa alquilada con sus dos hijos y desea tener una casa propia. 
MARIEL J., Es la tesorera del Banco comunal, ella vive en la misma zona es decir en su negocio es la venta D. comidas.  Vive en la casa propia con sus dos hijos, el negocio con el que cuenta actualmente es ambulante y D. la misma manera que las otras compañeras con el tiempo quiere llegar a tener su negocio fijo.
texts.en:
This communal bank is maD. up of 17 members. It belongs to the municipality of La Guardia, with a home base at Km. 9, in the neighborhood of 23 of December in the El Torno municipality, Santa Cruz, Bolivia. This group produces, prepares, and sells food items. The majority are neighbors in the area. Zulema D. is the leader of the group. She lives with her parents, her husband and four children at Km. 9, in the neighborhood of 23 of December, El Torno municipality. She sells food from door to door, and the loan she requires will be used to invest in this business to have more working capital. Over time, and with the income she makes with the help of the communal bank, she wishes to create a small store in her neighborhood. Mireya Rios is the secretary of the communal bank. She lives at Km. 9, in the neighborhood of 23 of December in the same area. She sells fruits at the market and also sells cosmetics. She lives in a home that she rents with her two children and would like to own a home. Mariel J. is the treasurer of the communal bank. She lives in the same area and sells prepared foods. She lives in her own home with two children. Her business is performed from door to door and just like her partners, she would like to have a stationary business.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Darwin

texts.es: Darwin es un joven de 20 años, el cual vive con su pareja, quien se encuentra embarazada. A iniciado su trabajo de agricultor  desde hace un par de años, siendo dentro de la agricultura, la cosecha, lo que más le agrada, debido a que ve más cercano el día en que podrá ver el fruto de su trabajo. Dentro de  los productos que le  gusta  cultivar se encuentra el café y el arroz, son productos que tiene mayor valor de venta dentro de su comunidad, la cual visitan los comerciantes cada temporada, además que se invierte mucho, pero se puede ganar mucho más, siendo sin embargo lo más difícil el sembrar y preparar las tierras para  la producción. Es su primer préstamo con MFP. Darwin requiere  instrumentos necesarios  para limpiar sus terrenos para lo cual  necesita un monto de 500 soles, entre otros gastos de sembrío que  requiere.
texts.en:
Darwin is 20 years old and lives with his partner, who is expecting a child. He has been a farmer for a couple years now and the part of his job he likes the most is the harvest, when the fruit of his labours begins to materialize. He prefers to grow coffee and rice, as these are quite valuable commodities in his community and sought after by traders, yet they are difficult crops to sow and cultivate. One must invest heavily at the beginning of the planting season but one can eventually turn an excellent profit from this initial investment. This is his first loan from MFP. Darwin will use the money, 500 soles, to buy the machines necessary to prepare his land for planting and to cover the other costs involved in sowing his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of farming equipment

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: La sra. Ana Maria, Rodríguez tiene 47 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Memorial Sandino, tiene  tres hijos de 10, 12,14 años de edad, que están estudiando, la secundaria, también su esposo le ayuda lo cual lo administran los dos es un taller de carpintería que lo tienen desde hace seis años, comenzó debido a la experiencia. dquirida por su trabajo anterior, aprovecho para poner su propio taller, con la solicitud de préstamo es para infraestructura en la remodelación de su taller, para dar buen servicios a sus cliente y aumentar las ventas, generándole buenos ingresos, a futuro es elaborar nuevos diseños para captar mas clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Maria Rodríguez is 47 and lives in a district called Memorial Sandino in the capital of Managua. She has three children, 10, 12, and 14, all secondary school students. Her husband helps her, and together they manage a carpentry workshop, which they have had for six years. Mrs. R. took advantage of experience gained from her prior job to open her own workshop. She is requesting a loan to remodel her workshop, so she and her husband can provide quality service to their customers and increase sales to generate strong income. Future plans include developing new designs in order to win more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to remodel her business

loans.name: Saleem Javed Group

texts.en:
Saleem J. baji is a 43 years old married woman and resides in a city named Multan, Pakistan which is famous for its shrines. She was unable to receive an education due to her lack of financial resources. Her husband, J. S., is a government employee. Saleem J. baji is the mother of seven children: five sons and two daughters. Her oldest son works in a factory. Another works in a general store. Her other children are receiving an education from a school which is located near their house. Saleem baji sells children's clothing which helps her husband meet the financial expenses of the family. She feels fortunate to be living in Multan because people come to buy clothes from different cities. She is applying for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

Saleem J. baji is a group leader of some more women of her locality. Rukhsana baji is requesting a loan to buy calling cards to resell. Abida parveen baji is requesting a loan to buy medicines for her medical store. Rasoolan baji is requesting a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Chama

texts.en:
Chama is a 49 year old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their four children. 
Chama has owned a grocery store for two years. She also sells sweets. Chama requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Chama has requested a loan. 
Her clients are her friends and neighbors. 
In the future, Chama plans to expand her business.

loans.use: Chama will use the loan to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Vida Group

texts.en:
Vida is a large group of 20 borrowers who are all trying to receive their second loan. With the first loan this group received they were all able to get their small businesses off the ground and start making some money. This second loan will help each individual grow their business and, hopefully, start increasing their earnings!

Sira M. is the representative of this group. She is an extremely hard working woman and she has to be because she has 4 young children she must take care of. Each child is under the age of 14 and requires a lot of attention and care. Before Sira's first loan she had almost no form of income and found it very difficult to even feed all her young children. With the first loan she started a very small cafeteria. She hopes to use this next loan to add a wider range of products to sell. She is very excited about her cafeteria and finally feels like she is going to be able to support her children and give them a better life. She is excited to finally have something of her own and she knows she will be a success someday!

Thanks for all your support!!

loans.use: Buy products for her cafeteria

loans.name: Bashiran Ghulam Rasool Group

texts.en:
Bashiran baji is 44 years old and a married lady citizen of a city named Arifwala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Bashiran baji completed her education up to 8th standard and couldn’t study further because she belongs to a poor family. Bashiran baji’s husband's name is G. R., a butcher by trade, who has been running a butcher shop in the community for the past 5 years.

Bashiran baji is the mother of six kids: five sons and one daughter. Her first four kids are daily wage laborers. The others are enrolled in a school and getting an education. Bashiran baji is applying for a loan to buy goats for her husband’s butcher shop.

Bashiran baji is the group leader for two other women from her locality. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Farzana baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy goats for butcher shop

loans.name: Dagiisuren

texts.en:
Dagiisuren A. lives with her husband and two teenage daughters in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her two children are high school students and her husband drives a passenger bus between cities. 

Dagiisuren has a small drug store in the Chingeltei district. She started the drug store in 2000, and her business has been a success from the start. From her profit, she has been able to rent a stall in a local apparel retail market that she runs in addition to her drug store. 

With these two businesses, her business capital has reached to 3,000,000 MNT ($1 USD=1,450 MNT). As her businesses do well, she needs more capital to expand. She requests a loan to buy more drugs and clothing for her shops. 

Dagiisuren is a hard-working woman with many dreams. She hopes that her daughters will receive good educations and pursue the careers that they choose.

loans.use: To buy more drugs

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie C. is growing pigs for a living. She thinks that having a piggery is a very productive business. She started raising pigs in 2004. Her husband,Rogelio C., constructed a concrete pig fence at the back of their house. Annie is just 44 and has 3 children in school.

She is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional 2 piglets. Aside from that, she will also use the loan to buy feed to fatten her pigs. She is excited about the possible income she will earn from the pigs that she raises.

CEVI is a non-profit organization organized to respond to the needs of small entrepreneurs. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana T., 40 years old, is divorced and blessed with two children who are in school. Diana is very hard working trader who provides food for her children. She enjoys selling cosmetics and said that this has been her major source of livelihood for the past five years. She says selling cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. Her shop is located at a strategic place in the market. Diana believes that with the loan, she would be able to purchase more stock of jewelries and cosmetics like pomade, hair cream, lipsticks, etc. to increase her inventory and income. Diana realized a need to add other things that are frequently demanded by her customers, which are vegetables like onions, tubers of yam, and frozen meat, etc. Diana belongs to a group called ‘St. Peters’.

loans.use: Diana wants the loan to buy more stock of cosmetic products, tubers of yam, and meats.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Mrs. T., residing at Sapang Dalaga, has been a regular member of Paglaum MPC for almost two years. She has a happy married life and is blessed with three children. Her husband is a motorcycle driver who can also help to support their family's needs.

Mrs. T. is thankful to Paglaum because, through the Co-op, she was able to obtain a loan in the amount of 4,000 that will be used as additional capital for her snack-vending business.

loans.use: To purchase materials for food preparation for her business

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra A. est une femme de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. elle tient une boutique d’alimentation générale à Womé, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. elle désire avec ce crédit aménager sa boutique pour contenir augmenter sa capacité et l'alimenter.
texts.en:
Abra A. is a 42–year-old woman, married, and the mother of five. She runs a general store in Womé, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She would like to use this loan to fix up her shop to accommodate the increasing of the shop’s capacity and to stock it.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix up her store and to stock it

loans.name: Lei

texts.en: Lei S. is 43 years old and married. She has 8 children, 6 of whom are with her. She works by making a very popular kind of food in Battambong Province. Selling the food, which is usually made of hashed meat (usually pork) wrapped and cooked in banana leaves, generates a a typical income of $2 US per day. S.'s husband is a skillful fisherman who works at Tonle Sap Lake and makes about $8 per day. Until recently, S.’s husband operated a small boat without a motor to enable his business. Thus, she has requested a loan of $500 to purchase a new motorized fishing boat because she thinks that fishing has been central to making a living for her family.

loans.use: Buying a motorized fishing boat

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 36 years old; she is married and a mother with two children. Her children are currently in school. To support her household, she has been hawking and selling cosmetics in her neighborhood to her loyal customers. She says selling of cosmetics is very lucrative and therefore she wants to expand her inventory to enable her to make good income for the family’s needs.

Rita walks very long distances to make sales; sometimes she does that by hiring a taxi to carry her goods. She is therefore appealing for your assistance to make good sales and take care of her home. She dreams of suffering for her children so as to provide them with education.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of cosmetics

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn G. helps her husband Ramiro run a motorcycle taxi business. He drives the moto, earning the income needed to meet the needs of their family including the education of their children. They are doing their best in sending their children to school. Three of them are in high school and the youngest is still in elementary school.

Aside from assisting her husband, Jocelyn also serves as a Barangay Health Worker in their village of Banquero Reina Mercedes, Isabela. She works as a preschool teacher and has a monthly honorarium of PHP 1,000 from the village funds which is also a big help in providing their basic needs. When there are no classes during summer, Jocelyn sells barbecue, boiled eggs, and snacks in the village to earn extra income. To help her husband in the maintenance of their taxi business, she would like to take out a loan of PHP 5,000 from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To support a motorcycle taxi business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La Señora Gladys B. cuenta con 39 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos, una mayor y dos menores y además viven con ella sus padres.
La actividad que realiza la Señora Gladys es la venta de artículos de primera necesidad tales como: arroz, fideo, azúcar, panificados y comidas, como ser: empanadas, milanesas, entre otros. 
Para poder comenzar con esta actividad, desde el año 1998, comenzó a realizar la venta de comidas rápidas montando un pequeño puesto en cada fiesta patronal de la ciudad, tanto fue el éxito de sus comidas que con el ingreso generado empezó la creación de la despensa. 
Gracias al espíritu emprendedor y la buena atención de la Señora,  en la actualidad ya tiene una clientela formada y sigue preparando comidas para la venta. 
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un congelador que le resulta necesario para la venta de bebidas bien frías. 
El objetivo principal de la Señora es ampliar su local y así poder montar un pequeño bar.
texts.en:
Gladis B., 39, is a single mother. She has three children; one is grown and the other two are minors. Also, her parents live with her. Gladys sells basic needs items like rice, noodles, sugar, and bread. She sells food like empanadas and “milanesas” (breaded and fried veal) among others. In 1998, in order to start this activity, she started selling fast food by setting up a small stand at every Patron Saint Festival in the city. The success of her food was so great that she used the income it generated to create her store. Thanks to her entrepreneurial spirit and her good service, she currently has a good customer base, and she continues to prepare foods to sell. The loan she is asking for is to buy a freezer, which she needs to sell very cold drinks. Her primary objective is to expand her location and set up a small bar.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a freezer

loans.name: Believe U Sef Group

texts.en:
Here are Zainab K., Hassanatu K. and Fatmata K.. These local entrepreneurs of Waterloo small town named their group Believe U Sef, a Krio phrase for “Believe in Yourself”. This will be the first loan they are accessing from SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses both in terms of size and quality. This will enable them make more sales, improve profit and consequently improving on their standard of living.

Zainab K. (middle) is the leader of this group. Zainab is approximately age twenty-four. She is married to a businessman and they have two children who are still not of school going age. Zainab has been a businesswoman for seven years now. Zainab owns a small stall where she sells cigarettes, biscuits, rice, “margi” (used to give sauce a sweet taste), sugar etc.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Concepción G. López, tiene la edad de 53 años, habita en el barrio San Caralampio, ubicado en La Concepción Masaya, junto a uno de su hijos, ella tiene cuatro hijos ya todos independientes, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de cada uno de ellos, doña Concepción desde hace 30 años se dedica a la agricultura, durante seis ciclo a trabajado con el financiamiento agrícola que le hemos brindado, el cual en una ocasión tuvo perdidas debido a los malos inviernos. Agradece a la institución por la oportunidad que siempre le brinda ya que son muchas las madres solteras que a través de estos fondo salen hacia delante con sus hijos y logran tener un vida digna. Comprara abonos para mejorar el cultivo y vender a mejor a precio.
texts.en:
Señora Concepción G. López, 53 years old, lives with her children in the San Caralampio barrio, located in La Concepción Masaya. She has four children who are all independent. Her plan for her family is to improve conditions for each one of them.

For 30 years, doña Concepción has worked in agriculture. During the six periods in which she has worked with the agricultural financing that we have offered her, there was one occasion in which she had losses due to a bad winter. She is grateful to the institution for the opportunities that it has always offered her. There are many single mothers who, along with their children, have been able to get ahead with such funding and succeed in having a dignified life.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy fertilizer to improve production

loans.name: Mayela

texts.en: Mayela M. Mauera is a 50-year-old married woman with five grown children who are still her first priority. She lives with her husband; her children have moved to Cartago, about three hours away. Mayela runs a general clothing store with her husband and needs a loan to buy more stock, specifically clothes and shoes. The store is located in a room in her house facing the street. She also has a small farm where she grows coffee and raises pigs. Previously she had a loan with Banco Nacional but this loan was more expensive than FUDECOSUR. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she hopes it will help her grow her business to support her youngest daughter's education.

loans.use: To buy more shoes and clothes for the store

loans.name: Copacabana Group

texts.es: El grupo “Copacabana” esta representada por la señora Martha y conformada por 15 miembros los cuales tienen la característica D. ser señoras muy trabajadoras les gusta la puntualidad, la unidad y sobre todo la solidaria. Las diferentes actividades a los que se dedica esto grupos es la comercialización D. productos como la yuca, abarrotes que sacan D. sus chacos para su comercialización y venden en la ciudad D. santa Cruz o Cochabamba, otras se dedican a la elaboración y comercialización D. pan, coca, repuestos y otros negocios D. acuerdo a la época D. producción D. los frutos D. sus chacos. El crédito solicitado es directamente para la adquisición D. mercadería y también para Invertir en sus terrenos o en sus medios D. trasporte ínter departamentales. La socias ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidaR. pero están muy a gusto con el apoyo económico que les brinda la fundación Agrocapital.
texts.en:
The Copacabana Group is represented by Martha. It is comprised of 15 members who are characteristically very hard-working women who like punctuality; unity; and, above all, solidarity. The different activities they are engaged in are selling products like yucca and groceries that they take from their farms to sell. They sell in the city of Santa Cruz or Cochambamba. Others make and sell bread, cocoa, and replacement parts. Others grow seasonal fruits. The loan is to buy merchandise and invest in their land or in their method of interdepartmental transportation. The members already have experience with village banks, but they are very content with the economic support the Agrocapital Foundation offers them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline V. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 37 years old. Evangeline is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline owns and operates a business selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over thirteen years and earns approximately $173 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Evangeline has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to pay tuition for her two children. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: LA SEÑORA ES UNA CLIENTE ANTIGUA Y PUNTUAL, EN SU HISTORIAL CREDITICIO DEMUESTRA PUNTUALIDAD Y RESPONSABILIDAD, SOBRE TODO DE MUY BUENA ACTITUD; LA SEÑORA CRISTINA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MUEBLES NUEVOS EN LA AVENIDA VICENTE OCHOA, EL NEGOCIO ES COMPARTIDO ENTRE SU ESPOSO Y ELLA, SU ESPOSO ES CARPINTERO Y SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE LOS MUEBLES Y ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MUEBLES, ELLOS EN LA ACTUALIDAD NO TIENEN NIÑOS,  EN SU TALLER DE CARPINTERIA TIENE UN AYUDANTE, PERO LA SEÑORA CRISTINA NO SOLO SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE MUEBLES SINO TAMBIEN AYUDA EN LAS LABORES DE LA CARPINTERIA EN EL LIJADO Y EN EL BARNIZADO, SU TRABAJO ES SACRIFICADO PORQUE ELLA TIENE QUE LEVANTARSE MUY TEMPRANO PARA ATENDER A SU ESPOSO Y LUEGO REALIZAR LA VENTA DE SUS MUEBLES, EL CREDITO SERA INVERTIDO EN A COMPRA DE DE MADERA POR MAYOR, AL REALIZAR LA COMPRA POR MAYOR LOS COSTOS LE SALEN MAS BARATOS.
texts.en:
This woman is an old and punctual client; her credit history demonstrates punctuality, responsibility, and above all a good attitude. Mrs. Cristina's business is the sale of new furniture in the Vicente Ochoa Avenue. This business is a collaboration between her and her husband; her husband is a carpenter and constructs the furniture while she focuses on the furniture sales. Right now, they don't have any children. In her husband's furniture workshop, he has an assistant, but Mrs. Cristina not only sell the furniture but also helps with the carpentry work – the sanding and the varnishing. Her work is very demanding because she to get up very early to help her husband and then begin to manage the furniture sales. This loan will be used to purchase wholesale wood, because purchasing wholesale is cheaper.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of wholesale wood

loans.name: Edith Damienne

texts.fr: H. Edith Damienne est née le 26 Septembre 1975 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Edith Damienne vit depuis 20 ans à Hlacomey à Cotonou. Mariée à ABDOUL Bissi, Edith Damienne est mère d'un enfant qui est scolarisé. Edith Damienne vit seul avec son enfant et supporte seule les charges de la maison. Edith Damienne a été à l'école jusqu'au cours secondaire. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de son enfant, Edith Damienne mène comme activité, la vente de tissu. Edith Damienne mène cette activité par le système de distribution. Edith Damienne vend également des habits pour adultes. C'est à Lomé au Togo que Edith Damienne s'approvisionne. Edith Damienne a 10 ans d'expérience dans ce domaine. Edith Damienne a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé et l'a bien remboursé. Afin de développer plus son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de ses clients, Edith Damienne sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
H. Edith Damienne is born September 28, 1975 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Edith Damienne has since been living in Hlacomey in Cotonou for 20 years. Married to ABDOUL Bissi, Edith Damienne is the mother of a child in school. Edith Damienne lives alone with her child and provide solely for the expenses of the house. Edith Damienne has up to secondary education. To meet her needs and those of her child, Edith is engaged in the sale of material as a business. She does this business through the distribution system. She also sells adults' clothes. She gets her supplies in Lome, Togo. Edith Damienne has 10 years of experience in this sector of business. Edith Damienne already had a loan once from ALIDe and repaid it correctly. In order to grow more her business and to better meet the requests of her clients, Edith Damienne is requesting a second loan from ALIDe.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Guandulin

texts.en: Guandulin M. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old, is married, and has six adult children. Guandulin owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling snacks like grilled banana with butter and other delicacies in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Guandulin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Las Hermanas Group

texts.es: El grupo las hermanas está integrado por tres mujeres que se consideran hermanas por ello el nombre. Estas son  Sofía G. quien tiene una pulpería, Martha Lorena B. quien vende cosméticos y  Teresa de Jesús E. que comercializa ropa.
texts.en:
The group "Las Hermanas" (The Sisters) is made up of three woman who consider themselves to be like sisters, and this explains their group name. They are: Sofía G., who has a small grocery store, Martha Lorena B., who sells cosmetics, and Teresa de Jesús E., who sells clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy staple grains, meat, soft drinks, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 38 years old, single, and he lives in Nyamagabe, a region of the southern province of Rwanda. Here, Innocent owns a business selling bread produced from his bakery. This is his fifth successful year in this business. His business is open from 7 AM to 5 PM every day.

Innocent has a target of increasing the sale of bread in his business so that he can satisfy the demand of his customers. To reach this goal, he would like to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, Innocent will purchase a large quantity of raw materials, including flour and sugar, etc. With this additional quantity of bread, Innocent hopes that the number of his customers will increase as well as the profits.

Innocent has a goal of expanding his business through creating many sources of income selling the same products. With this method, he will also try to sell at the lowest price so that a higher percentage of the people can be able to buy at least one loaf of bread.

loans.use: Additional quantity of flour for producing more bread

loans.name: Cheat

texts.en:
C. Cheat, 43, is married with three children who live at home in the Takeo province. Since 1984, she has been making and selling palm cakes in her village. She makes about US$3 profit a day. Her husband is a blacksmith. On average, he makes US$6 a day. Two of their children go to school and one is a construction worker. 

Every month C. Cheat spends about US$80 on food, US$10 on utilities and about US$20 on transportation. C. Cheat would like to take out a loan to expand her husband’s business. Her husband will use the loan to purchase blacksmith tools.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith tools.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 32 years old and married with three children who attend school.   She sells fruits, onions, tomatoes and potatoes in an open air market. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has been able to offer her children better education.   She hopes to increase her finances and have high standards of living in the future.   She has requested a loan of kes 20,000 from Faulu Kenya to add stock and expand her business.  She describes herself as hardworking, faithful, and self reliant.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Roquela

texts.en:
Roquela N. is from the village of Palacapao, Quezon Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Roquela is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Roquela owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Roquela has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Roquela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roquela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI. Roquela decided to request a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Roquela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of coffee and cocoa

loans.name: Elba Felicita

texts.es:
Elba felicita C. Gutiérrez es una señora trabajadora, esforzada, decidida  quien desde muy joven trabaja para ganarse el pan de cada dia. Ella desde hace veinte años aproximadamente inicio con su negocio de taller de carpintería donde realiza desde cunas, roperos, camas etc. 
C. con el préstamo invertirá en madera, pintura, clavos etc.  Ya que tiene muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
Elba Felicita C. Gutiérrez is a hard-working and decisive woman who, from a very young age, has worked to make a living. About twenty years ago, she started a carpentry workshop where she makes cribs, dressers, beds, etc. She will use the loan to invest in wood, paint, nails, etc., since she has many orders pending.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood, paint, etc.

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “PACAHA ILLARIY”; Nuestro socio vive en la comunidad de Llullucha,  distrito de Ocongate,  provincia de Quispicanchis departamento de Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él  Sr. Cecilio,  él socio tiene 26 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, Nuestro socio  trabaja como porteador en camino a Ausangate con diferentes agencias de viajes que prestan servicio a la zona de los nevados. Nuestro socio también va a camino inka con sus amigos a trabajar cuando escasea el turismo en la zona. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatillas y una bolsa de dormir yu con la otra parte comprar víveres para su hogar.

El soco agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the "PACAHA ILLARIY" community bank. He lives in the community of Llullucha in the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. Our member, Sr. Cecilio, is 26 years old, partnered and the father of 2 children. He works as a porter for different travel companies around Mt. Ausangate in the Peruvian Andes. When tourism falls off, he works with friends along the Camino Inka. He is applying for a loan, partly to buy shoes and a sleeping bag and partly to buy everyday necessities for his family. The member is grateful for the help that this kind of lending provides and is committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoes, sleeping bag and household necessities.

loans.name: Sydonie

texts.fr: A. Sydonie est née en 1976 à Ifangni, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Mariée à ALETEDJANON Paulin, Sydonie est mère de six enfants, tous scolarisés. Sydonie vit avec son mari et ses enfants à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis huit ans environs. Le couple subvient ensemble aux différentes charges de la famille. Sydonie n'a pas été à l'école. Pour assurer ses besoins, Sydonie  prépare et vend de l'"akassa" (aliment local fait à base d'amidon de maïs) à son domicile, et de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Sydonie vend de l'huile de palme. Sydonie s'approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, et aussi au marché de Houègbo au Bénin. Sydonie exerce cette activité depuis sept ans. Dans le but d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et par ricochet sa production, pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Sydonie sollicite un premier crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Sydonie A. was born in 1976 in Ifangni, in the Ouémé region. Married to Paulin Aletedjanon, Sydonie is the mother of six children, all of whom are educated. Sydonie has lived with her husband and children in Ekpè, in the Sèmè-Podji community, for about eight years. Together, the couple supports the family. Sydonie did not go to school.
