To meet her needs, she prepares and sells "akassa" (a local dish made from a maize starch base) from her home and door-to-door. As secondary work, she sells palm oil. Sydonie stocks up on supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin, and also at the market of Houègbo in Bénin. Sydonie has done this work for seven years. With the goal of increasing her working capital and increasing production, thus better satisfying her clientele, Sydonie is asking for her first loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of maize and barrels of palm oil.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To diversify his business by buying sanitary products and reselling them at a profit

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a forty-eight-year-old clothing vendor residing in Battambang Province. She currently sells clothing for both men and women from her store in the local market. She is married with four children; one is already married and other three are single. Her husband is a military policeman. 

S. is an energetic woman who never wastes time as she works to earn the money to encourage all her kids to attain the highest levels of education. She has managed her investment carefully and has attracted a large number of customers due to her communication skills. 

S. has a son who is skilled at repairing mobile phones and he hopes to use his knowledge to earn money, but he doesn’t have money to use as capital. Therefore, S. has requested a loan of US$ 1,200 for her son to purchase repair material and essential tools to begin a phone mending service.

loans.use: To purchase any repair materials and tools

loans.name: Maina

texts.en:
Maina has been operating his mixed farm for the last thirty years in the town of Murang'a in Central Province, Kenya. He produces coffee which he sells to the local market and also earns income from carpentry services he offers to the local people.

Maina is 64 years old and married with nine children who are all adults. His youngest child is currently attending school.

Maina has requested this loan of KES 53,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the income from the sale of its milk will help him in paying school fees for his youngest child.

Maina hopes to expand his dairy farming from indigenous breeds to exotic breeds. He says that Juhudi is doing a commendable job by helping peasant farmers to acquire assets.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Elyn

texts.en:
Elyn T. is from the village of Barandias, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Elyn is married and has three school-aged children. Elyn owns and operates a business butchering and selling meat in the market. The main source of income for the business comes from butchering & selling pork in the market. Elyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2008, Elyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 8,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional pigs & as working capital.

Elyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase additional pigs & as working capital. This loan will be her third from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: purchasing additional pigs; working capital

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “HATUN SONCCO ” ; El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gumercinda;  ella tiene 52 años de edad, es  casada y tiene 4 hijos;  La socia se dedica a trabajar en sus propio cafetín situado en la calle arco iris;  ella trabaja desde el año 2003 y alterna sus actividades del hogar con este negocio.  La socia desea poder implementar su cafetín y vender más variedades de postres, bebidas frías y calientes; A futuro la socia desearía tener  sucursales en todo Cusco.  La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en implementar su cafetín. 
                  .
La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Gumercinda belongs to the community bank, "Hatun Soncco", which is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province of Cusco, in the state of Cusco. Gumercinda is 52 years old, is married and has 4 children. She dedicates herself to running a small cafe on the street "arco iris". She has worked here since 2003 and alternates her household duties with this business. Gumercinda wishes to be able to set up her own cafe and sell more varieties of desserts and hot and cold drinks. In the future, she would like to have branches in all of Cusco. Gumercinda is requesting this loan to invest in setting up her own cafe. She is thankful for and values the loan granted to her and promises to comply with the payment of her installments in the timeline established.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in setting up her own cafe

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en: Maricel M. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City. She is 27 years old and is married with one infant child. Maricel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Maricel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Bertine Mélanie

texts.fr: Madame Bertine Mélanie C. est une femme mariée de 47 ans qui habite Baye Laye. Elle s’active dans le commerce depuis longtemps et est surtout spécialisée dans la vente de légumes, et détergents (eau de javel, savon liquide).C’était dans le souci d’épauler son mari qui est parti a la retraite qu’elle avait opté pour cette activité de commerce qui est bien rentable pour elle sauf que pendant l’hivernage les légumes se font rares. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis décembre 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs dans le but d’augmenter son stock de marchandises en cette période de Ramadan. Avec l’accroissement de ses bénéfices elle souhaite satisfaire les besoins  de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertine Mélanie C. is a 47 year-old married woman who lives in Baye Laye. She has been in business for a long time and specializes mostly in the sale of vegetables and detergents (bleach and liquid soap). She chose this line of business in the hope of helping her husband, who is retired. Her business is profitable except that vegetables are scarce during the winter. She has been a member of the Baye Laye credit union since December, 2003. She has already repaid 2 previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs with the goal of increasing her stock of merchandise in this Ramadan season. She hopes to meet the needs of her family with the increase in her profit.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Sandra Yanira

texts.es:
Doña Sandra Yanira M. tiene 45 años de edad es casada actualmente se dedica al comercio tiene 2 hijas mayores de edad.
Sandra inicio su negocio de modista cuando tenia 18 años luego tubo una pequeña tianda en la comunidad de Villanueva por varios años pero decidio trasladarla a su casa donde la administro con ayuda de su familia, su tienda duro 20 años pero serro por motivo de la delincuencia.
actualmente se dedica a vender productos mexicanos, ahora Sandra solicita un nuevo credito a Fape y a Kiva para poder invertir en compra de granos basicos y bebidas ya que tiene una propuesta de comprar por mayor y con descuento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra Yanira Méndez, 45, is married and has two adult daughters.  She is a merchant.

Sandra started her business when she was 18 years old and later had a small store in Villanueva for several years but decided to move it into her home where she ran it with help from her family.  Her store stayed open for 20 years but had to close due to crime in the area.

She currently sells Mexican products and is requesting funding from Fape and Kiva to invest in basic grains and beverages because she has an opportunity to buy at wholesale and with a discount.

loans.use: To buy basic grains and beverages.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie T. is from the village of Paglaum Village, Lumbo, Valencia City. She is 46 years old. Annie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Annie makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling chicken and pork barbecue. She is also buying and selling fish like bangus and sardines, while her husband is engaged in repairing computers and other electronic products. Annie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2010, Annie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Annie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn E. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 32 years old. Analyn is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Analyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, junk food, toothpaste, and canned goods, in the local community. She also buys and sells gasoline by the liter and agricultural feed for pigs by the kilogram. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2009, Analyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory, and as working capital for the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Analyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory, and as working capital for the business

loans.name: Mao

texts.en: Mao N. is a 27 year old man who lives in Kompong Chhnang Province. To earn a living, Mao spends at least eight hours per day in the construction field. He normally earns an average of $2.50 per day to help cover his family’s daily living expenses. Mao has a life partner in his mother who operates a business in front of her home selling pots which are made from clay. Presently, Mao faces difficulty with transportation in that he always hires a taxi when he needs to go to work or anyplace else. To reduce the cost of transportation, he would like a $400 loan in order to buy a used motorbike for riding to work.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike for riding to work.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL AMANECER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gabriela; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es casada; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de ropa, ella vende en forma independiente y lo distribuye a diferentes tiendas de ropa, ella quiere tener una tienda donde pueda vender la ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa como pantalones, blusas y chompas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Communal Bank “El Amanecer” [The Sunrise]. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, Province of Cusco in the Department of Cusco. 

The member is Mrs. Gabriela.  She is 29 years old and married. She divides her time between house chores and buying and selling clothing. She sells to individuals and distributes to other stores. She would like to have her own store to sell the clothing.

Mrs. Gabriela is requesting the loan to buy pants, blouses and jackets. She is grateful to the lenders who contribute to make her dreams come true and is committed to paying in a timely manner.

loans.use: The member is requesting the loan to buy clothes like pants, blouses and jackets.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy M. is from the village of Sinaman, Dipolog City. He is 28 years old, married, and has no children. Jimmy operates a family member's business in the food sector, making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. He has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately $105 a month.

In 2009, Jimmy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. 

Jimmy is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his 2nd loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell in his carenderia

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe S. was born in 1983 in Ijevan city, Tavush region. He is married and has two children, a son and a daughter. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children and Vahe works as a crane operator. He takes orders for loading and unloading building materials and other goods, and thanks to this employment he is able to support his family. He takes orders not only from Ijevan city, but from other cities and villages in the Tavush region. He says his service is in popular demand, so he must always maintain his crane.

Vahe needs a 900.000 AMD loan to change his crane’s gearbox and to do some other repair work on it. This is Vahe’s second loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To change his crane’s gearbox and do some other repair work on it

loans.name: Señor De Wimpillay Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Señor de Wimpillay” tiene 13 ciclos de funcionamiento (cada ciclo son 4 meses),  el banco comunal está conformado por 11 mujeres y 2 varones. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la casa de una de las socias. La casa está ubicada en el barrio “Margen Derecha de Winpillay” del distrito de Santiago de la ciudad del Cusco. La mayoría de los socios son vecinos y tienen una buena amistad. 

Los socios son trabajadores y emprendedores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos.  Las actividades económicas de algunos de los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo; venta de crema de leche, venta de frutas, venta de comestibles, venta de muebles, venta de artesanía de tipo trenzado, fabricación y venta de muebles de madera, venta de textiles y venta de comida de forma ambulatoria. Otros socios se dedican a brindar servicios de salón de belleza, empleado de la municipalidad y docencia. 

La socia Isabel, tiene 42 años, vive junto con su pareja y sus hijos en el pueblo joven de manco Ccapac del populoso distrito de San Santiago. Su actividad económica principal de Isabel es la venta de comestibles, ella vende sus productos en la su propia tienda que está ubicada en su domicilio, se la pueden encontrar a la socia en su negocio de lunes a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien.  Isabel va invertir el préstamo en el capital del negocio y desea comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, leche, azúcar y muchas cosas más.
texts.en:
The communal bank, “Señor de Wimpillay”, has gone through 13 loan cycles (each cycle is 4 months).  The communal bank is composed of 11 women and 2 men.  The communal bank's meetings are every thirty days at one of the member's home.  The house is located in the neighborhood, "Margen Derecha de Winpillay" in the Santiago District of the city of Cusco.  The majority of the members are neighbors and are good friends.

The members are workers and entrepreneurs that are always looking for opportunities to move ahead and help give their children a brighter future.  The economic activities of some of these members include, the sale of milk cream, fruit, groceries, furniture, artisan work, the making and selling of wooden furniture, textiles, and food stalls.  Other members offer beauty services, are employed by the municipality, or teach. 

The member, Isabel, is 42 years old and lives with her spouse and their children in a new town, Ccapac, of the populated San Santiago district.  Her main economic activity is the sale of groceries.  She sells her products from her own store that is located in her home.  She works Monday through Sunday from 6am until 9pm.  She has had this business for many years and it is going well.  Isabel plans to invest her loan as work capital for her business and wants to purchase more merchandise such as rice, noodles, milk, sugar, and other things.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise such as rice, noodles, milk, sugar, and other things.

loans.name: Carine

texts.fr:
Carine a 30 ans est  très active en coiffure et esthétique depuis 2004 après sa cessation comme agent à l’aéroport ou elle préparait des plats pour des vols nationaux.

IPCA coiffure est sa référence et set installée sur une avenue très fréquentée par des jeune filles qui se coiffe avec des tissages à la mode.
Son créneaux, faire un travail professionnel, le respect envers ses clientes, l’accueil  et l’utilisation des produits de haut de gammes.

Du lundi au samedi, elle a des recettes qui avoisine  les 15000f  pendant les périodes de cérémonies comme mariages, baptême, fêtes de fin d’année et autres fêtes religieuses les revenus arrivent jusqu’à 75.000f jour. 

Mère célibataire et 2 enfants à sa charge, IPCA, se bats pour leur réussite scolaire et veut ouvrir une salle de soin esthétiques avec son second prêt pour être une professionnelle de renommée nationale.
texts.en:
arine is 30 years old. She has been  very active working as a hairdresser and beautician since 2004, after leaving her job at the airport where she used to cook meals for national flights.

Her business is know as “IPCA hairstyling,” located  on a busy avenue and very popular with young women who let their hair to be styled in fashionable braids. Her guiding principles are professionalism in her work, respect and friendly welcome offered to her clients and the use of high-quality products. From Monday to Saturdays, her sales approximate 15000 West African Franc. During festivities, such as weddings, christenings, end of the year holidays and other religious holidays, her sales go up to 75,000 per day. 

A single mother with two children in her care, she works hard to provide them with a good education. With her second loan, she would like to open a beauty salon and become a nationally known beautician.

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics such as hair gel, hair straightener, facial cleansers, manicure and pedicure products

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy L. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Juvy is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Juvy owns & operates a retail store selling vegetables like eggplants, squash and string beans in the local community. Juvy has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Juvy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase vegetables to sell, such as cucumbers and beans. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Juvy from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables to sell

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 39 ans, 5 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, d’habillements, de savons et de pâte d’arachide.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Tiessiri sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. 
CHITAN T. compte acheter des habillements avec les grossistes du marché de Dioïla presque à chaque foire hebdomadaire. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20.000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Tiessiri group, all married women, are on the average 39 years old, with five children, and all live in traditional extended families in the town of Dioïla, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as friends, relatives and neighbors. They sell condiments, clothing, soap and peanut paste.

The Tiessiri group members are on their third solidarity loan. Chitan T. plans to  be buying clothing from wholesalers at the Dioïla market, almost every week. She sells daily, out of her home and at the market, for cash and in credit to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 20,000 West African Francs, which will be used to pay off the loan and cover her contributions to big social events, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase some new tools and wood for her son's carpentry business

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en: Mrs.Oyuntsetseg is 54 years old and lives with her husband and grandson in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her grandson attends a secondary school and her husband helps in her business. She operates a game room which has PC games, a snooker table and ping pong tables. She has a plenty of customers because her business is located in the basement floor of a small shopping center and there is a secondary school nearby. Children come to play  PC games and table tennis because not many families can afford to have Internet or PC at home. Oyuntsetseg is planning to improve the game room condition, adding a restroom and putting up walls to separate the PCs from ball games. She is asking for a loan to build a restroom and walls and to replace the green cover of the snooker table.

loans.use: to build a restroom and walls, and to replace the green cover of snooker tables in game room.

loans.name: Jeny Rossana

texts.es: La señora Jenny tiene 39 años es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos que están en edad escolar, ella vende ropa para damas caballeros y niños  desde el año 2008, se amino a realizar esta actividad para dedicarle mas tiempo a sus hijos, antes trabajaba en un fundo como obrera de campo, con ese dinero ahorrado invirtió en el negocio de venta de ropa y ahora se dedica a esa actividad en forma diaria su  ingresos semanales es de s/ 500, los desafíos que enfrenta es que vive en casa de un familiar por que no tiene casa propia, su sueño en el futuro es hacer crecer su negocio, y además adquirir una vivienda para vivir con sus hijos, el dinero lo invertirá en compra mercadería por cambio d estación como chompas pantalones cafarenas entre otras cosas, Jenny esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Jenny is 39 years old.  She is a single mother and has three school-age children.  Her business is selling women's, men's and children's clothes.  She has been doing this since 2008.

Jenny decided to start working in this business activity so that she could devote more time to her children.  She used to work on a large farm as a field laborer but she saved up some money which she then invested in this clothes-selling business.  She now sells clothes every day.  Her weekly income is 500 Peruvian soles.

The challenge that Jenny faces is that she lives in a family member's home because she does not own her own home.  Her dream for the future is to grow her business and buy a house to live in with her children.  She will invest her loan money in buying merchandise for the change of season.  She will buy sweaters, pants, turtlenecks (polo necks), etc.  Jenny is very grateful for the support that she is being given.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the new season such as sweaters, pants, etc.

loans.name: Sonia Teresa

texts.es: La Sra. Sonia vive en la localidad de el torno, es de ocupación transportista, también se dedica a la venta de plantas frutales que ella distribuye en su movilidad, el destino del crédito es para comprar llantas y mantenimientos de su camioneta, hace servicio  el torno a la forestal una comunidad a 15 km del pueblo, es nacida en el departamento de Cochabamba, a su corta edad se vino a trabajar a la ciudad de Santa Cruz, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, en la comunidad de espejos, tiene cuatros hijos los cuales están a su cargo, y junto a su esposo los están sacando adelante, se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo económico que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Sonia lives in El Torno and provides transportation services.  She also sells fruit plants that she distributes with her vehicle.  The loan will be used to buy tires and to service her vehicle.  She provides service on the El Torno-Forestal route, a community that’s 15 kilometers from town.  She was born in Cochabamba Department but came to work in the city of Santa Cruz at a very young age.  Her husband’s a farmer in the community of Espejos.  She has four children in her care that she’s raising together with her husband.  She is grateful to the institution for the economic support it has given her.

loans.use: to buy tires and to service her vehicle.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 35 years old and the father of two. He sells fish to earn a living for his family. He has operated the business for 17 years and so far has employed two people to assist him in his tasks. Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business with his previous loans. He hopes to have a well-established business in the future. He needs 50,000 Kes to add stock of fish.

loans.use: To add stock of fish

loans.name: Mayrenik

texts.en: Mayrenik is living in the Shirak region of Armenia in the village of Metz Mantash.  She was born in Metz Mantash and has lived her entire life there.  The main activity in Mayrenik’s village is agriculture.  She has a high school education and has been farming with her husband for the past fifteen years.  She has two wonderful children – a twenty-one-year-old daughter and a twenty-year-old son.  Mayrenik hopes she will be able to support her children to help them finish their university education.  She would like a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  This investment should increase the family income by twelve percent.  Mayrenik is pleased with microfinance services and looks forward to the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Matalau

texts.en:
Matalau is 36 years old and married with three children. Matalau owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale.  She has one year of experience in this business. 

Matalau needs a loan of WST $1,000 to rent land to raise additional crops.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2011, Matalau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Matalau's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to rent land to raise additional crops

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Laxmi is 35 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 12 and 10.  In 2005, she established  her grocery shop business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to expand the inventory of her store.  

In the future, Laxmi plans to  expand the business.  She thanks you for your support. 

For a borrower to improve her living standard, extra training is needed. In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called  "pasal", are an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical "pasal" might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods.

loans.name: Kiem

texts.en:
Mrs. Kiem, 42, is homemaker. She stays at home to care for her four children and tends to her daily routine as well. Mrs. Kiem’s husband provides for the family’s expenses with his income as a motor taxi driver in and around Siem Reap Province. Besides this, he was hired by his neighbors to guard their land for extra income. 

Mrs. Kiem is applying for loan to buy some ducks and chickens to raise for sale and also to ordain her son as a Buddhist monk.  Mrs. Kiem is photographed with her husband in front of their house.

loans.use: to buy some ducks and chickens to raise for sale and also to ordain her son as a Buddhist monk.

loans.name: Rut

texts.en:
Rut is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is widowed, with 2 children.  Rut has a shop that sells fish. He has had this business for 5 years.

He requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell.  Rut has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rut hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 24-year-old married man. He has worked in furniture making since 15 years ago. He was too small when he started working but it's all because he had to help his parents in covering their expenses and struggling for a living.

Mahmoud is a man with a good reputation; he seeks perfection in his work that he started and works hard on improving as much as he can to make sure that this business will provide him with the best living ever for his family members.

That's why Mahmoud requested a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to buy new and improved machines necessary for developing his business in a short period of time with the best quality of work possible.

This is his first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he hopes it will be a good experience to invest.

loans.use: To buy new and updated machines necessary for his business.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine lives in Uganda. She is single and has two children who are in school. She also takes care of  her mother. 

Justine lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include electricity, rent and school fees.   

Justine has a business of a restaurant. She has been in this business for two years, and she works seven days out of every week.  

Justine has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, chicken and a bag of rice. 

The main business challenges for Justine include defaulters and rainy season. Her goal for her business is to own a fully stocked restaurant and she also hopes to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy more beef, chicken, bunches of bananas and a bag of rice.

loans.name: Saulo

texts.en:
Saulo is 32 years old and lives in the town of Nebbi in the Luweero region of Uganda.  He is married and has 2 children.  One of his children is currently in school.  Saulo has a business of selling clothes, which he has had for 6 years.  He also sells shoes as his second business.  

To help expand his business, Saulo has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase shoes and clothes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Saulo hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child.  In the future, Saulo hopes to expand his business into wholesale.  Saulo is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise program which has helped his prospects for the future by lending him enough money to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase shoes and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es: El señor Alberto es empleado y realiza trabajos de limpieza en una oficina de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción para la refacción del alcantarillado de su casa. Vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona de Tacagua en la ciudad de La Paz;  es divorciado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y por el carácter social del mismo es que el cliente desea que se canalize a través de los financiadotes de Kiva.
texts.en:
Alberto is employed to do cleaning jobs at an office in the city of La Paz.

He needs the loan to buy construction material in order to repair the sewer at his house.

He lives in his own house in the Tacagua zone in the city of La Paz.  He is divorced, and he has two children.

This is his first loan request from Impro. Based on his social character, he wishes that his loan request be channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to fix the sewer at his house.

loans.name: Cuellar Huayhua

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES UNIDAS”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de San Jeronimo en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. H., la socia tiene 55 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta de productos mojados, la socia vende papa deshidratada, moraya, habas remojadas para hacer habas saladas, entre otros productos, la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de productos secos para venderlos comprara productos como habas, papa, quinua, pallares entre otros para prepararlos y llevarlos a vender al mercado, la socia desea el crédito para incrementar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos para preparara y llevarlos a vender al mercado en su stand, la socia comprara habas, papa, quinua, pallares entre otros que los remojara para venderlos como productos secos.
La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “MUJERES UNIDAS” ["United Women"] Communal Bank, located in the San Jeronimo District in the Province and Department of Cusco.
This is Mrs. H.. She is 55, married, and has four children. She buys and sells snack products. She sells dehydrated potatoes, moraya [a processed potato dish], coated broad beans for making bean salads, and other products. She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of dried goods to sell, such as beans, potatoes, quinoa, and butter beans. She will prepare them and sell them in the market. She wants this loan in order to expand her business. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of dried goods to prepare and bring to sell in the market at her stand. She will purchase beans, potatoes, quinoa, and butter beans, among other items.
She is grateful for your support and promises to repay her quotas in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to purchase beans, potatoes, and quinoa

loans.name: Mgalla

texts.en:
Mgalla is a married man with six children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, Mgalla has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, Mgalla wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and salt. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and salt.

loans.name: Boy Samson

texts.en:
Boy Samson is 39 years old and lives in Upper Loboc, Oroquieta City. He is married and has three children. 

Boy Samson has a fruit vending business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. He has a requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more fruits and vegetables for his fruit vending business. 

Boy Samson has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for his fruit vending business

loans.name: Kumba

texts.en:
Kumba is a twenty seven year old single man who lives in a rental house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food for himself and house rent.

Kumba has operated a retail shop for the past three years. His potential clients are his neighbors and passers by. He faces a major challenge of transporting his goods from point of purchase to his shop. He dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan Kumba wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for his shop. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because it helps small scale business owners by giving them loans to expand their business.

loans.use: To purchase maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for his shop.

loans.name: Margarita Yessill

texts.es:
La señorita Margarita tiene 21 años de edad y vive en el municipio de San Pedro Sula en el departamento de Cortes. Margarita es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 4 años. Los dos viven con la madre de Margarita. 

En los fines de semana, Margarita vende tamales y sopas. Ella ofrece una gran variedad de comida incluyendo tamales de pollo y de res, y sopas de pollo, res, caracol y marinera. Como complemento a la comida, también vende jugos naturales de nance (una fruta pequeña y amarilla de Honduras), mora, y otros sabores. 

Después de haber estudiado en una universidad pública de la región, Margarita no pudo encontrar trabajo. Pensando en su hijo, ella optó por vender comida para estar estable en su casa y dar más atención a su hijo. 

Ya tiene un año trabajando por si misma y ella nota que un desafío para su negocio es cuando los precios de insumos suben, porque ella tiene que aumentar el valor de su producto. Está solicitando un crédito de L10,000 para comprar carnes, condimentos, hojas para tamales, manteca, y una olla. Su meta es llegar a tener una franquicia de negocios. Sus esfuerzos están dedicados al negocio y ella espera que todo salga excelente. Ella quiere ofrecer a su hijo un bienestar y futuro seguro y darle una buena educación.
texts.en:
Señorita Margarita is 21 years old, and lives in the municipality of San Pedro Sula, in the department of Cortes.  Margarita is a single mother of a four-year-old son.  They both live with Margarita's mother.

On weekends, Margarita sells tamales and soup.  She offers a large variety of food for sale, including tamales made from chicken and beef, and different kinds of soup: chicken, beef, winkle and seafood.  To go with the food, she also sells natural juice made from nance (a small yellow fruit from Honduras), blackberry, and other flavors.

After studying at the region's public university, Margarita wasn't able to find work.  Thinking about her son, she decided to sell food so that she could work from home and give more attention to her son.  She has already been doing this work for a year, and she notes that one challenge for her business is when prices of raw ingredients rise, because then she has to increase the price of her products.

She is requesting a loan of L10,000 to purchase meat, spices, leaves for the tamales, butter and a cooking pot.  Her goal is to expand to have a franchise of businesses.  Her efforts are dedicated to her business, and she hopes that everything will move ahead wonderfully.  She wants to provide her son with well-being and a secure future, and to give him a good education.

loans.use: to purchase meat, spices, leaves for tamales, butter and a cooking pot.

loans.name: Franco

texts.en:
Franco is a married man with three school aged children. His wife is a businesswoman who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. Franco owns a house with electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees for his children.

Franco has operated a poultry business for the past six years.  His potential clients are the local area café and hotel owners. He faces a major challenge of lack of enough market to sell his products. He dreams of expanding his business.

With the Kshs 40,000, he wants to purchase more chicks and chicken feed for his business. He decided to join Yehu because of their favorable terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chicken feed for his business.

loans.name: Ufufuo Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ufufuo SHG Group in Western Kenya! Elizabeth is the facilitator of the Ufufuo SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Elizabeth  takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Elizabeth had a very good maize yield harvesting 21 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Elizabeth was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elizabeth  and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Elizabeth will save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Ufufuo SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

The picture shows Elizabeth and her group with the field officer far right.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is a married woman who works hard to support her family. She has been buying and selling mangoes in the Philippines for 24 years. She has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of mangoes to sell.

In the future, Marietta would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of mangoes to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with 3 school-aged children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.

Cecilia owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like canned goods, cooking oil, vinegar and spices. Cecilia also grows ducks and sells fresh fish to her neighbors. Cecilia works hard to help provide for her family and to send her children to school. She plans to use her loan to buy duck feed, more fish and items to sell such as canned goods.

In the future, Cecilia hopes for her children to be successful.

loans.use: to buy duck feed, more fish and items to sell such as canned goods

loans.name: Thacienne

texts.en:
Thacienne is 55 years old. She is married with 8 children aged between 5 and 24 years, they all go to school. She is a farmer and has been farming for the past 8 years. With the loan requested from kiva, she would like to pay who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to increase her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay who harvested maize.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.en:
Domingo is 31 years old and has a beautiful 10 year-old daughter. He started his business 16 years ago doing small jobs at his brother’s workshop and later found a place to establish his own business. Domingo studied through high school but it has been difficult for him to find work. He is missing one of his hands, but with much effort he learned to do his job well and he is accepted by his customers.

Domingo needs a loan for $475 USD to purchase tools that can make his work easier and more efficient. In addition to be missing a hand, he must also manage to cover all of his daughter’s expenses. Therefore, he really needs all your support and consideration.

** Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch:

Domingo tiene 31 años de edad y tiene una hermosa hija de 10 años; comenzó su negocio hace 16 años haciendo pequeños trabajos en el taller de su hermano y después encontró un lugar para establecer su negocio. Domingo solo estudio hasta la secundaría, pero le ha sido difícil encontrar trabajo debido a que no tiene una de sus manos, por lo que con mucho esfuerzo aprendió a trabajar y actualmente tiene mucha aceptación entre sus clientes.

Domingo necesita de $475 USD para comprar herramientas que le puedan facilitar el trabajo y trabajar con una mayor eficiencia. Además de no tener una mano, el necesita cubrir con los gastos de su hija, por lo que requiere de tu apoyo y cariño.

loans.use: Purchase tools that can facilitate his work.

loans.name: Iris Suyapa

texts.en:
I have dedicated myself to the preparation of women's clothing for three years. I make blouses, skirts and dresses for people who request my services. Currently I have sufficient work because some schools have asked me to make blouses for their students, since I can sell it to them at lower prices than the stores. At the moment I need to buy fabrics to finish the order and then make clothes for the summer. My children help me put bottons on the clothes, which has helped me not have to delay the orders.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer.

Tengo 3 anos de dedicarme a la confeccion de ropa para damas, fabrico blusas, faldas, vestidos de personas que buscan mis servicios. Actualmente tengo bastante trabajo ya que algunas escuelas me pidieron les fabrique las blusas de los ninos, ya que les doy precios bajos comparados a los precios de tiendas. En este momento necesito comprar telas para terminar de entregar el pedido y luego fabricar otra ropa de verano. Mis hijos me ayudan a pegar los botones de las camisas lo que me ayuda para no retrasar los pedidos.

loans.use: Buy fabrics, threads, embroideries, buttons zippers, etc.

loans.name: Junior Omar

texts.en:
Hello, my name is Junior Omar. My main work is in the manufacturing of metals. I have a workshop in the city center. I have been working for the past two years in this business, and it provides me income to cover my family's and supplier's expenses.

Translated by Kiva volunteer Maite Barragán

Hola Mi nombre es Junior Omar, mi actividad principal es la manufactura de metales, cuento con un taller en el centro de mi ciudad, tengo 2 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para mis gastos familiares y demas compromisos con los proveedores.

loans.use: Purchasing industrial pipes, thick sheet metal,  electrodes and fine sheet metal for lining

loans.name: Cecilia Albina

texts.es:
Mrs. Ceci G. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and her 4 children, aged 13, 8, 5 and 3. The two eldest children are in school and the two youngest will be going to the same school. Her husband is a government eemployee who works on construction projects. He recently changed positions and now works paving roads.

Ceci owns and runs a store where she sells all kinds of products, particularly food products. Thanks to her good client service and the variety of products in her store, she now has a large number of clients in the neighborhood. She says that her most popular products are sugar, charcoal, wine and milk.

Ceci comments that due to her husband's work and low salary, she finds herself working just to meet the family's expenses. The people of the neighborhood consider her a strong and enterprising woman, and she is admired within the community.

She needs the loan to be able to stock more merchandise, especially the items in high demand by her existing neighborhood clientele. As one of few convenience stores in the area, she finds herself enjoying lots of demand during this cold season.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Ceci G. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en pareja y tiene 4 hijos de 13, 8, 5 y 3 años respectivamente. Los dos mayores están estudiando y los menores van a ir también a la misma escuela. Su pareja es un empleado público y trabaja en obras de construcción. Recientemente ha cambiado de trabajo y ahora trabajo con pavimentos.

La Señora es dueña y administra un almacén en donde vende todo tipo de productos esencialmente comestibles,gracias a su buena atención y variedad de productos, hoy día tiene un gran numero de clientes en el barrio. Relata ella que lo que más vende en su local es azúcar, carbón, vino y leche.

Cuenta la señora que debido al horario de trabajo de su marido y al bajo salario que este percibe, ella se encuentra trabajando sola para poder costear los gastos de la familia; por lo que la gente del barrio la considera una mujer fuerte y emprendedora, admirada por varia gente del barrio.

Requiere el crédito para así poder abastecerse con más mercaderías, especialmente las más solicitadas por su clientela ya formada del barrio. Como una de las pocas despensas del área, ella se encuentra con una alta demanda debido a esta época de frío.

loans.use: Buy merchandise: flour, sugar, coffee, milk and eggs

loans.name: Seam

texts.en: Mrs. Seam K. (32) lives with her husband and 3 children in the Siem Reap district of Cambodia. Seam K. is engaged with cutting bamboo and selling it to the retailer for $2.50. Her husband is a trailer driver and earns $2 a day from this. Seam K. is applying for this loan in order to purchase timber to build a new house. She would like to make her home a safer and more comfortable environment for her 3 children.

loans.use: To build a house (buying wood)

loans.name: Ma'anih

texts.en: Ma'anih is 45 years old and she's married. Her business is selling household goods such as cooking oil, rice, snacks,  eggs, etc. Her husband has no fixed income. Ma'anih usually earns $1.50 per day in profit.  She is a member of MBK and needs IDR 500,000 loan to complete her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To complete her shop

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
Manuel M., bearer of BI#110020318W is 41 years old. He is a native of Maputo and currently resides in the Ndlavela district. He is married with 4 children. He sells coal in sacks. This is his second loan cycle in the program. The first loan was $210US and now he is asking for $425US for 6 months. He intends to use the money to grow his business.

Translated by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Manuel M. , Portador de BI nº110020318W, de 41 anos de idade , Natural de Maputo residente em maputo, no bairro de Ndlavela,Vive maritalmente com 4 filhos vende carvão em sacos esta no programa no 2º coclo no primeiro tomou 5000 agora vai tomar 10000 para pagar em 6 meses ,com o dinheiro pretente aumenta o seu negocio.

loans.use: Increase stocks

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en: Nisrine is a 23-year-old mother of 2. She lives with her family in Aley. Nisrine does embroidery and other kinds of handicrafts. She is supporting her family with the revenue of her business. This is the fifth time Nisrine is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs to buy the necessary material to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy material for her business.

loans.name: Yai

texts.en: Mrs. Yai Sophal, 38, is a seller of a variety of groceries, making on average $20 a day of income. Her husband, Mr. Mao Sophal, 40, is a motor-taxi driver and normally earns around $2 a day. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase more vegetables and food to meet the customer demand. (One of her daughter who is wearing grey cap is pictured in the back because Yai Sopal was unavailable).

loans.use: Purchase more groceries to meet the customer demand.

loans.name: Pilar

texts.es:
Pilar is very enthusiastic and always motivates her own to be vigorous. Thanks to her iniciative and her husband's talent for the work, they have acquired two motor taxis with which they give transportation service to their community. She is in charge of administration and her husband drives one while they rent out the other. Hard days when their earnings weren't enough increased Pilar's worries, so she decided to breed piglets and guinea pigs in order to placate these epochs and increased the family earnings with the dream of soon establishing a motor taxi enterprise in their little community. Your important support will serve to increase the number of baby animals and the earnings and desires for progress of this family.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Pilar, es muy entusiasta y siempre motiva a los suyos a esforzarse, gracias a su iniciativa y el talento para el trabajo de su esposo han adquirido dos mototaxis con los que prestan servicios de transporte a su comunidad; ella se en carga de la administración y su esposo conduce uno mientras el otro permanece en alquiler, los días duros en los que los ingresos no eran los suficientes la preocupación de Pilar se incrementaba, fue entonces que decidió criar cerditos y cuyes para aplacar estas épocas e incrementar sus ingresos familiares con el sueño de pronto establecer una empresa de mototaxis en su pequeña comunidad.Tu importante aporte servirá para incrementar el número de animalitos y las ganancias y deseos de progreso de esta familia.

loans.use: Purchase of more baby animals. - Compra de mayor cantidad de animalitos.

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin S. is a 38 year old rice farmer in the province of Kampong Cham. She earns less than US $1 per day farming. Her husband, Sek Chea, does a little bit better as an ice cream vendor in Siem Reap province earning US $5 per day. Of their three children, one is currently employed as a security guard making US $30 monthly. She wants to take out a loan to buy the necessary wood to fix her family home, which they can't afford on their regular income. They also hope to save some money to someday buy Sek Chea a motorbike, which he can use to make his business mobile.

loans.use: To renovate their home

loans.name: Saray Bich Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Saray B., the group leader, is a mat maker in Prek Rang Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Her husband, Mr. Theourn Chhin, is a construction worker and fisherman. Although she and her husband both work, they only earn a small income.

Mrs. Saray B. has started building a new house to replace the family’s old house, but she does not have enough money to finish it. This loan would be combined with profits she has saved for many years to complete the new house.

Mrs. Saray B. previously obtained a loan from AMK to buy two fishing nets.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Barily

texts.en: Barily lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and he has a construction supplies shop. He works in the shop with one of his brothers and his father. He loves his business. Barily has been involved in this business for more than 5 years in Kabul. He wants to enlarge his shop, so he has requested an individual loan. With the loan, he will buy more supplies for his shop. A larger shop will increase his income, help his brother and his father and make a brighter future for himself.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Bertille

texts.fr:
Born on November 9, 1966 in Cotonou in Littoral County, Ms. Bertille A. is married and the mother of two children, who are both in school. Her husband Eustache HOUNDJO is an accountant who lost his job several months ago. Ms. Bertille A. is a seamstress by training and has been residing in the AÏDJEDO district for eleven years. For seven years, she has been selling ready-to-eat meals in a private educational complex in her district. She is also a distributor of various goods, namely damask fabrics, soap, rice, pagne (traditional print cloth), vegetable oil, and other products. This second business activity that, in the beginning, she used to do only during vacation time, has become something daily, since her husband lost his accountant's job. She makes her purchases in the Dantokpa marketplace and also in Lomé in TOGO. As a result of financial difficulties tending to handicap improvements in her businesses, she had come to take on an initial loan of 60,000 francs CFA in 2007. Because of her very fruitful initial experience, she requested and obtained her second loan, which she repaid successfully. She comes now to request a third loan of 150,000 francs CFA for the purposes of meeting her customers' expectations.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Née le 09/11/1966 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral, dame A. Bertille est mariée et mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Son mari HOUNDJO Eustache est comptable mais ce dernier a perdu son emploi il y a quelques mois. Dame A. Bertille est couturière de formation et réside au quartier AÏDJEDO depuis 11 ans.Elle du repas prêt à manger dans un complexe scolaire privé de de son quartier depuis 7 ans. Elle fait également de la distribution de produits divers à savoir: bassine, savon, riz, pagne, huile végétale et autres produits. Cette deuxième activité qu’elle exerçait au départ seulement pendant les vacances est devenue quotidienne depuis que son mari a perdu son emploi de comptable. Elle fait ses achats au marché Dantokpa et aussi à Lomé au TOGO. Suite à des difficultés financières tendant à handicaper l’évolution de ses activités, elle vint contracter en 2007 un premier crédit de 60.000F CFA. Forte de sa première expérience très fructueuse ; elle a sollicité et obtenu son 2ème prêt qu'elle a bien remboursé. Elle vient maintenant solliciter un troisième prêt de 150.000 F CFA en vue de satisfaire ses nombreux clients.

loans.use: To buy three boxes of FANICO soap, two boxes of BF soap, six large bowls, and a sack of rice (50 kg)

loans.name: Dorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Dorn Choen, 39, and her husband, Mr. Sam-at Vak, were married in 1990 and have one daughter who attends the local school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Dorn has been a silk weaver since 1987, a skill she learned from the villagers. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been building wooden houses since 2000. He does his work in their village and nearby village. The couple lacks the money to build their own house, so Mrs. Dorn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase materials to build her house.

loans.use: To purchase materials to build a house for her family.

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
Darío es un hombre de 58 años, vive con su esposa. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura,  y desde que se casó volcó toda su experiencia en los campos de cultivo, para junto a su esposa, logren el bienestar de su familia, gracias a ello, sus hijos ahora son independientes y tienen su propia familia, ahora, ambos siguen trabajando el uno por el otro.Esta actividad le toma  gran parte del día y le demanda mucho esfuerzo para  realizarlo, pero le agrada, sobre todo el cuidado de sus productos, para lo cual compra diversos productos como abonos y fertilizantes que le ayuden a mantenerlos sin problemas, pero los costos de estos, son muy elevados.
Darío tiene que velar por su pareja, esto le da mayores motivos para esforzarse en su trabajo.
Ahora quiere invertir en la producción de yuca, tener una muy buena producción que le resulte lo suficientemente rentable para tener otro negocio que asegure el futuro y la vejes de él y de su pareja.
texts.en:
Dario is a 58 year old man who lives with his wife. He has always worked in agriculture, and since his marriage, he has put his experience to work in the fields so that he and his wife might achieve well being in their family. Thanks to their hard work their children are now independent with families of their own. Now, the couple works to support each other. Their jobs take up most of their time every day, and require plenty of hard work, but they enjoy it. They are especially proud of their product, which they care for by purchasing manure and fertilizer which help them to grow their crops successfully. The cost of these necessary items, however, is very hight. Dario must care for his wife every day, and this is his main motivation to work hard. He would like to make an investment in Yucca production, so that he can have a successful enough crop to start another business which will provide a secure future for him and his wife.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in a yucca plantation, increase his income and be able to have another business when he is no longer able to work the fields

loans.name: Gelgi

texts.es: Doña Gelgi tiene 42 años de edad, habita en el barrio Campo Bruce de la ciudad de Managua, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos, dos varones y una mujer. Doña Gelgi es costurera, tiene 9 años de experiencia en esta actividad lo que le ha servido para que actualmente cuente con más clientela con la que empezó. El uso del préstamo será para la compra de telas para elaborar manteles, colchas, sábanas, etc. Debido a la gran dedicación a su trabajo actualmente tiene más clientes y una demanda de servicios más grandes, y no desea dejar por fuera algunos clientes por no contar con suficiente capital.
texts.en:
Ms. Gelgi V. is 42 years of age and lives in the Campo Bruce neighborhood of the city of Managua. She is single and has 3 children—two sons and a daughter. Ms. Gelgi is a seamstress with 9 years of experience in this field, which has helped her gain more customers now than when she started out. The loan will be used to purchase fabric to make tablecloths, bedspreads, bed sheets, etc. Due to her dedication to her work, she currently has more customers who demand even more services, and she does not want to leave out any of her customers for lack of capital.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora tiene 63 años, vive con su esposo y un D. sus hijos. Hace 6 años abrió una tienda en su propia casa, a fin D. tener una vida más tranquila, ella y su esposo se jubilaron, desean seguir trabajando, pero D. manera independiente, es así que Teodora es la encargada principal D. la atención D. su establecimiento, los días donD. recibe mayores entradas, es cuando son las fechas festivas D. su localidad como patronales, fiestas patrias, día D. los santos, etc. Teodora no desaprovecha ninguna oportunidad para crecer, es por ello que siempre está al pendiente D. innovar y mejorar su tienda para mantenerse activa. Teodora trabaja para sentirse bien con ella misma y disfrutar cada momento. Solicita este préstamo con el que podrá adquirir mercadería para su tienda.
texts.en:
Teodora, 63, lives with her husband and one of her children. Six years ago she opened a shop in her home. In order to have an easier life, she and her husband retired, they wanted to keep on working, but independently. Teodora bears the main burden for the shop. The busiest days are the local festivals such as labor holidays, national holidays, holy days, etc. Teodora doesn't waste any opportunity to grow, making sure to innovate and improve her shop to keep herself active. Teodora works for her own well-being and she enjoys every minute. She is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise for her shop.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of merchandise in her shop

loans.name: Maoul Koffi

texts.fr: Né le 26 mai 1976, monsieur D. Maoul Koffi est marié et père de deux (2) enfants. Depuis 2005, il a vendu par livraison des cartes de recharge dans le quartier d’Agoè au nord de Lomé. Ce premier crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des cartes de recharge de toutes les compagnies de téléphonies au Togo (Togo cellulaire, Moov et Illico).
texts.en:
Born on May 26, 1976, Mr. Maoul Koffi D. is a married father of two children. Since 2005 he has been selling and delivering rechargeable phone cards in the region of Agoè in the north of Lomé. This first loan that he is requesting will allow him to purchase rechargeable phone cards for all of the telephone companies in Togo (Togo cellulaire, Moov and Illico).

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of rechargeable telephone cards

loans.name: Azalatu

texts.en:
Azalatu I. is a married woman. She is thirty years old and the mother of four children. Azalatu lives with her husband and children in a town called Ejura in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She enjoys trading and has been selling for over fifteen years in the town where she lives. 

She sells food items like beans, maize, groundnuts [peanuts] and others. She buys her goods from the farmers in her locality and surrounding towns. Azalatu sells to the people in her area, most of whom are food vendors. She says she desires to buy the goods in bulk so that she can reach a larger size of the market by trekking to markets in nearby towns. This, she says, is only possible by increasing her working capital. Basically, this is what she aspires to use the loan for. 

Azalatu belongs to a group in her community known as ‘Rely on God’. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk beans, maize, groundnuts (peanuts), etc.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru:
Сайфуллоева Парвина одна из молодых предпринимателей в городе Душанбе. Ей 21 год, не замужем. С самого детства Парвина любила шить. После средней школы, решила развивать свои способности в этом направлении. Как она говорит – «Женщина должна уметь шить». Так и начала свой бизнес с шитья национальной одежды. Сейчас она шьет платья со штанами, детские одежды, а также делает реставрации. У нее своя швейная машинка. Парвина имеет много постоянных клиентов.
Хочет получить займ в сумме 4000 сомони для закупа сырья: нить, основной и прокладочный материал  и другие принадлежности.
texts.en:
Parvina S. is one of the young entrepreneurs of the city of Dushanbe. She is 21 years old, not married. Parvina loves to sew since she was a child. After graduating from school she decided to develop her skills in this direction. As she says - "A woman must know how to sew." She started her business by sewing national Tajik clothing. Right now she makes dresses with pants, children's clothes and also restores old ones. She has her own sewing machine. Parvina has many regular clients.

She wants to get a loan for 4000 somoni (USD$1050) to buy raw materials: threads, fabrics and lining materials and other supplies.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials: threads, fabric and supplies

loans.name: Omo

texts.en: Omo I. is a 48-year-old married woman with 10 children.  To earn a living, she sells palm oil.  She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $350 (50,000 NGN) in order to expand her inventory; in other words, she would use the loan proceeds to purchase more palm oil for resale purposes.  She thanks Kiva and all lenders for their support.

loans.use: To increase her inventory by purchasing additional palm oil

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana K. is 30 years old, divorced, and the mother of four children. She lives with her children who are in school. She got divorced due to pressure from the husband's parent. In spite of the challenges she faces, Susana believes in hand work and dedication, which are the secret of her success. She owns and operates a local restaurant where she sells local foods like banku. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains, and it is eaten with hot pepper or soup. She also sells ice water in a sachet form attached to her food joint. Susana realized automatically that after eating, people would need water to quench their thirst. 

Susana needs a loan to enable her to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She says the cost of raw materials is very high now. She also wants to save part of the loan to venture into crop farming in the near future. Susana belongs to the village bank called ‘Adom Akyede’ meaning the Gift of Grace. She is grateful for your assistance. She hopes to receive GHS1000 to restock her inventory. Susana has been in business for five years now.

loans.use: To buy maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en: Farzana K. is 48 years old married lady and a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the last 30 years.  She is an uneducated lady because her parents couldn’t afford her education expenses.  Farzana got married with Mr. Afzal Goga who runs a scrap business in the community.  He buys old stuff (wooden cupboards, plastic bottles) at cheap rates and sells them to the factories and earns income.  Farzana is the mother of eight kids: five sons and three daughters.  My first two sons work in a factory on a monthly wage. The next is involved with his father’s scrap business.  The next younger has a lath business.  The others are getting education from a local school.  Farzana successfully repaid her four loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy scrap for her husband’s scrap business.

loans.use: Buy scrap for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok I., age 42, sells fresh fishes in the busy market. As another source of income, she is buying and selling used goods out of her home. In both businesses, she can generate $4 per day to support her family's food requirements.

She has been married for years wI. four children who are single. One of her sons is learning a skill as a motorbike repairman and he will invest his knowledge to earn money. Mrs. I.'s husband works as a supervisor of military policemen.

The family also needs to pay for a taxi to get to work and when they want to go somewhere. They hope to reduce the cost of transportation. Thus, I. is requesting a loan to purchase a used motor for the family's requirements.

loans.use: To purchase a used motor for the family's requirements

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua S. is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter. She says both of her children are in primary school. Akua says she lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a tailor by profession. She works to assist her husband financially.

Akua is a petty trader. She sells costume jewelry of all kinds and ladies’ underwear. She sells at the local market and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Akua buys the merchandise from wholesalers in Accra. She has been in business for seven years now and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry and ladies’ underwears

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy jovial y entusiasta, pues siempre busca animar a sus seres queridos a seguir adelante para lograr sus metas; junto a su esposo dan ejemplo de constancia, pues lograron adquirir una casa con la que pueden brindar a sus hijos un lugar donde habitar seguros. Casarse no la limitó a seguir trabajado en la actividad que le da tantas satisfacciones desde muy joven, estudió cosmetología y se desarrolló profesionalmente con este oficio desde hace 10 años,  tiene instalado un local en el mercado de su localidad, donde atiende todos los días desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, y gracias a la cercanía  que tiene de su domicilio puede cumplir con sus roles como madre y esposa, tratando siempre de distribuir adecuadamente su tiempo para no descuidar ningunas de sus actividades. Pero hay épocas donde su labor es muy demandada y requiere de apoyo tiempo para terminar de atender a su clientela, por esa razón empezó a ambientar un espacio en su casa para su salón, lo que está pronto a concluir y donde se trasladará con la finalidad de contar con el apoyo necesario de su familia, además de dejar de realizar el pago del alquiler del local. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, y espera seguir trabajando con la misma responsabilidad como hasta hora junto a su grupo. Con los 1000 soles que solicita invertirá en la compra maquinarias necesarias para su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Gladys is a jovial and enthusiastic 46-year-old woman. She always tries to lift the spirits of those who are dear to her and help them get ahead and reach their goals. Gladys and her husband are examples of perseverance. They have been able to get a house so they can give their children a secure place to live. Getting married has not stopped Gladys from working in the field that has given her much satisfaction since she was a young woman. She studied cosmetology and has developed professionally in this field for ten years. She has a place in the local market where she works every day from ten in the morning until ten at night. Luckily it’s close to her home so she can fulfill her roles as mother and wife. She always tries to distribute her time adequately so as not to neglect any of her activities.
