But there are times when her job is very busy and she needs time to finish serving her clients. This is why she began to fix a space, which is near completion, in her house for a salon. She will move into her new home salon with the goal of having her family’s support, as well as not having to pay rent for the space in the market. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she hopes to continue working with the same responsibility that she has so far with her group. She will invest the 1000 soles in the purchase of machinery necessary for her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de maquinarias para su salón

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is 42 years old and married with 5 children. She sells drinks and provisions.  She is requesting the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase a generator as an alternative source of power. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchases a generator

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.es:
Gertrudes es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa Siembra en quechua.
Gertrudes es casada, tiene 40 años y 5 hijos, Gertrudes vive en la comunidad de Pampa Cangallo que se encuentra a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho, en donde tiene una tienda de abarrotes. Además Gertrudes se dedica a la compra de quesos en su comunidad y lo comercializa en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Gertrudes necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Los sueños de Gertrudes son construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Gertrudes is a member of the Communal Bank Tarpuy, which means Harvest in Quechua. Gertrudes is married, 40 years old, and 5 children; Gertrudes lives in the Pampa Cangallo community that is located 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho, where she has a small grocery store. In addition Gertrudes dedicates herself to the purchase of cheeses from her community, which she sells in the city of Ayacucho. Gertrudes needs a loan of 1,000 PEN, money that will be invested in the purchase of cheeses. Gertrudes dreams of building her house in the city of Ayacucho and stocking her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cheeses.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea S., 52, operates his own motorbike transportation service. He transports his customers to the local markets, typically making an income of US $4 per day, in Battambong Province. He is married, but he has no children.

S.’s current business is the primary income for the family and covers all the expenses. However, he and his wife plan to create an additional business to provide more income. S. wants to take out a loan of US $800 for his wife to operate a grocery business at home.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma S. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 59 years old. Wilma is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Wilma owns & operates a business providing motor cab for hire services to local community members. Wilma has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (about $62 US) a month for these activities.

In 2006, Wilma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 pesos from PMPC. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 pesos which will be used to purchase materials needed to repair the motor cab for better service. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the motor cab

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a member of the Muungano C borrower group in Ilala,Iringa,she is 40 years old woman,she is widowed and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged  23 years.

Rehema started  her own food business 4 years ago,she works 9 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 300,00 Tanzania shillings.


This is Rehema first loan from BRAC Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,0000 in order to buy rice,cooking oil.

With the profit she gains from the use of this loan Rehema hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy rice,cooking oil

loans.name: Mr. Phoeurn Suon Village Bank Loan Group

texts.en:
Mr. Phoeurn S. and his wife, Mrs. Khen Touch, are farmers who own a plot of land cultivating rice to earn a living. They have a small problem with their plantation, because the field has infertile soil which has a bad effect on their crop. Thus, Mr. Phoeurn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the field. He is 59 years old and the father of two children: one of whom is a goldsmith while the other is attending the local school.

Eighteen people living in Angk Svay Chek village in Takeo province make up this village bank loan. Mr. Phoeurn S. is the village bank president, selected by the members. They will all use the loan for different purposes.

Ten members of this group have end-of-term loans (the rest have monthly payment loans). They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna owns a restaurant. She is 37 years old and married with a child. She is from Okada Area of Edo State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase a refrigerator for cooling drinks and water. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator for cooling drinks and water

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de mèches, tissage et postiches

loans.name: Nicolás Antonio

texts.es: Nicolás Antonio P. E. de 61 años de edad, reside en Zacatecoluca municipio del departamento de La Paz. Nicolás vive en casa propia con su mama doña Julia de 90 años de edad. Nicolás es un hombre soltero nunca se caso, solo tuvo un hijo que ahora se encuentra en Estados Unidos. Nicolás cuida de su madre quien por su edad necesita de muchas atenciones,  es por ello que Nicolás ha buscado la manera de generar ingresos sin salir de su casa, para así cuidar el mismo de su madre ya que los costos de una enfermera no están a su alcance, por el momento Nicolás administra su negocio una tienda de productos de consumo diario y es la misma que ahora desea surtir por medio de este crédito.
texts.en:
Nicolás Antonio is 61 years old and lives in the municipality of Zacatecoluca which is in the La Paz department. He lives in his own home with his mother, doña Julia, 90. Nicolás is single, he was never married but did have a son who lives in the United States. Nicolás cares for his mother who, due to her advanced age, requires a lot of attention. This is the reason why Nicolás has sought ways to generate income without having to leave his house so that he himself can care for his mother since the cost of hiring a nurse is beyond his means. For the moment, Nicolás runs a general store and requests funding to stock it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his store.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
El banco comunal Tres Marías se encuentra a unos 15 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca en la comunidad del mismo nombre en el sur de la ciudad, esta localidad goza de una belleza natural y biodiversidad por su lugar de ubicación, su gente adulta se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería mientras que los jóvenes trabajan en la ciudad o han migrado al extranjero para darles una mejor vida a su familia.
 
La señora Mariana L. es socia activa del banco comunal Tres Marías, ella  vive por el sector de la autopista a unos 15 minutos fuera de la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de una niña  de siete años,  no tiene casa vive  en casa de sus padres.

Mariana trabaja en su  tienda de abarrotes desde hace diez años pero también se dedica a la cría de animales como pollos, cuyes, chanchos,  los alimenta y cuando ya se encuentran gorditos los vende en las ferias.

Lleva dos años trabajando con su banco comunal y está contenta porque los créditos recibidos los ha invertido en sus negocios,  con el nuevo préstamo que realiza en la FUNDACIÓN ESPOIR va a  comprar otras líneas de productos de aseo personal, productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, pastas, etc. para abastecer mejor su tienda y dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, también va a comprar más pollos porque son de crianza rápida máximo en un mes y medio.

Su sueño es llegar a convertir a su tienda en un micro mercado y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Tres Marías communal bank is located about 15 minutes outside the city of Cuenca, in the community of the same name south of the city. This town boasts natural beauty and biodiversity, due to its location. The adult population work in agriculture and the raising of livestock, while the young citizens work in the city or have moved abroad to earn a better life for their families. Mrs. Mariana L. is an active member of Tres Marías communal bank. She lives near the highway about 15 minutes outside Cuenca. She is 44 years-old and a single mother of a 7 year-old daughter. She does not have her own house, she lives with parents. Mariana has worked in her grocery store for ten years, but also works raising animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs. She feeds them and then sells them in the markets when they are large enough. She has been working with the communal bank for two years and is happy with the loans she has received and invested in her business. With the new loans from FUNDACION ESPOIR, Mariana will buy other brands of personal hygiene products, basic items such as rice, sugar, oil, pasta, etc, in order to better supply her business and provide better service to her customers. She will also buy more chickens that will grow rapidly, in under a month and a half. Her dreams are to succeed in making her store into a small market and to build a house.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Credo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rice, sugar, oil, pasta, personal hygiene products to stock her store, and for the purchase of more chickens.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou G. is from the village of Lower Dicayas. She is 38 years old. Marilou is married and has 8 children. The eldest is adult; six of them are school-aged, and the youngest is an infant. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing manicure and pedicure services to local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Marilou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase manicure and pedicure materials, and livestock feed and supplies for her pig-raising activity. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Marilou from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the daily needs of the family and education expenditures of her children.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase manicure and pedicure materials, and livestock feeds and supplies

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Sandra del Carmen Pérez, desde hace 16 años se dedica a la agricultura, gracias al apoyo de su esposo, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es por la crisis económica por la cual enfrenta el país y eso hace que no logre comprar los insumos necesarios para poder mejor sus cultivos de piña, doña Sandra con el préstamo va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos agrícolas para darle un mantenimiento adecuado a la producción de piña , ya que si ella logra esto va a beneficiarse en lo económico para que el mismo cultivo pague el desembolso y con las ganancias poder ir mejorando su vivienda poco a poco , ella habita en un barrio alejado del pueblo del municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo el cual trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que tienen cuatro hijos a su cargo los cuales estudian actualmente . Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic a través de los fondos Kiva, ya que son muchas  familias  logran una mejor vida con estos tipos de programa para el desarrollo del país .
texts.en:
Señora Sandra del Carmen Pérez has been dedicated to agriculture for 16 years. Thanks to the support of her husband, the greatest difficulty that she is presented is the economic crisis faced by the country which prevents her from buying the necessary supplies to be able improve her pineapple crop. With this loan Señora Sandra is going to buy fertilizers and agricultural supplies for the adequate maintenance of her pineapple crop. If she receives this loan, she is going to benefit economically so that the crop will repay the loan and with the profits she will be able to improve her dwelling little by little. She lives in a neighborhood located far from the municipality of Ticuantepe along with her husband, who also works, and supports him with the expenses of the home. They have four children in their care, who all attend school at present. She thanks Afodenic for their support through the funds from Kiva, since there are many families who achieve a better life with these types of programs for the development of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her pineapple crop

loans.name: Badenya  (Kinship) Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Badenya  de l’association Danaya est composé de 10 femmes toutes mariées ayant    une  moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 4 enfants et vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies au village de Yangasso, préfecture de San (Région de Ségou, République du Mali). 
Elles se sont  connues   à travers des liens   de voisinage et de parenté. 
L’activité  principale de ces femmes du groupe Badenya est l’achat et la vente d’arachide, de haricot et d’habits. Elles sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Pour satisfaire  le  besoin de leur clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter, le groupe Badenya eu une solution à ses problèmes en intégrant  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Le groupe est à son troisième  prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe) après avoir correctement remboursés  tous les prêts précédents. 
Elles  comptent utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 95 sacs de 100kg  l’arachide,  30 sacs de 100kg de haricot et  quelques colis d’habits pour enfants. 
Elles s’approvisionnent auprès des producteurs et effectuent leurs ventes en détail, quelques fois en gros, au  comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de consommateurs et de revendeurs
Elles espèrent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 23 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille élargie et investir le reste dans les activités. , 
NB: Sur la photo de groupe, elles sont au nombre de 9 parce que la dixième du nom de Djélika Traoré était allée  pour la présentation de condoléances à des parents du village.
texts.en:
The group Badenya of the association Danaya is composed of 10 women, all of whom are married, have an average age of 30 years and an average of 4 children each. They live in large, traditional families in the town of Yangasso, in the area of San (Region of Ségou, in the Republic of Mali). They know one another through the neighborhood and also through familial relationships. The main business of the women in the group Badenya is to purchase and re-sell peanuts, beans and clothing. They are very sought out for their goods. In order to satisfy the needs of their clientele and so that their customer base does not stop growing, the group Badenya found that the solution of their problems was to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is the third group loan that the women of Badenya will take together, they have fully repaid their previous loans. They will use this loan to purchase ninety-five 100 kilogram sacks of peanuts, thirty 100 kilogram sacks of beans and some sets of clothes for children. They will supply themselves directly from producers and re-sell the products at retail prices, sometimes at wholesale prices, for cash and credit to a clientele composed of customers and re-sellers. They hope to each earn an average monthly income of 23,000 FCFA, which they will use to pay the interest on their loan, to pay for the needs of their families and will invest the rest in their businesses. Please note: In the photo of the group, there are 9 women because the tenth woman, called Djélika Traoré had gone give her condolences to the town elders.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase peanuts, beans and clothes for re-sale.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Madame ami K. est une femme de 54 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Layenne a Yoff. Elle est divorce et mère de 2 enfants dont l’âgé varie entre 14 et 16 ans. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC de Yoff depuis octobre 2009. Les occupations de Madame K. sont surtout orientées vers la couture et le commerce. Elle s’est très tôt lancée dans la couture depuis 1973 aussitôt qu’elle a abandonne les études. Ainsi sa maman l’a beaucoup motive dans l’activité de couturière. Ce qui lui plait le plus ce sont les progrès effectues et aussi la confection de beaux habits qu’elle fait. Disposant d’une seule machine a coudre  Madame K. souhaiterait une seconde pour une meilleure compétitivité de son travail.
Madame K. a une activité secondaire qui est la vente de beignet a cote de son domicile. Elle emprunte 250 000 frs pour l’acquisition d’une deuxième machine. Le reste de l’argent va lui permettre d’acheter des sacs de mil et de sucre destines a la préparation des beignets a base de mil  qu’elle commercialise. L’évolution de son activité et par conséquent l’accroissement de ses profits lui permettent de gérer la dépense quotidienne et de constituer un soutien a ma petite famille.                  
Toujours  dans son optique de participer activement a la lutte contre la pauvreté   l’U-IMCEC avec l’appui positif des prêteurs   réussit   à soutenir  les populations  à exercer des  activités  lucratives génératrices de revenus, ce  qui favorise un développement  socio économique   apprécié.
texts.en:
Mrs Ami K. is a 54-year old woman who lives in the Layenne neighborhood of Yoff. She is divorced and has two children who are 14 and 16 years old. She has been a member of the Yoff savings bank which belongs to U-IMCEC (a mutual loan and savings union) since October 2009. Mrs K.'s specialises primarily in sewing and trading. She ventured into sewing as early as 1973 when she abandoned her studies. Her mother strongly encouraged her in her sewing activity. What pleases her most is the progress she has achieved and also the fabrication of beautiful costumes. Mrs K. has a secondary activity which is the sale of fritters next to her home. She is borrowing 250,000 francs for the acquisition of a second machine. The rest of the money will allow her to buy bags of millet and sugar in order to make the millet-based fritters that she sells. The development of her business and the consequent growth in her profits will allow her to cover her daily expenses and provide financial support for her small family. As part of the ongoing vision to participate actively in the battle against poverty, U-IMCEC, with the backing of its lenders, is successfully supporting people to carry out lucrative revenue-generating activities; this in turn is contributing to a welcome socio-economic development.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of working capital and investment

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: L. Sra. Janet tiene 36 años D. edad  es conviviente tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar, su conyugue trabaja como panificador, elL. cuenta con una bodega bien surtida D. productos D. primera necesidad, frutas y verduras, elL. cuenta con exte negocio hace 9 años, su negocio esta ubicado en pasaje el huerto  en casa propia D. material noble D. un piso. L. Sra. Janet cuenta con muchos suueños  y objetivos uno D. ellos es poder tener una casa mucho mas amplia, con el dinero que solicita invertira en  incrementar su capaital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Janet is 36 years old. She has two children who are school age. Her spouse works as a baker. She has a store that is well stocked with basic products, fruits and vegetables. She has had this business for nine years. Her business is located in a passage in the garden of her one-storey home, which is maD. from brick. Janet has many dreams and goals. One of these is to be able to have a bigger house. With the money she is requesting, she will invest in increasing her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For working capital.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu L. is the 37-year-old single mother of two children. She lives in the Majaoni area of Mombasa. Saumu does retail sales of charcoal and firewood in an area called Mkoroshoni and has been in the business for the last two years. It has been a paying business for her.

Saumu was introduced to KADET by an existing client and she is glad to begin her first loan. With the money, she intends to purchase firewood stock and also to purchase charcoal for reselling. She mainly serves the households in the Mkoroshoni area.

She hopes to start selling supplies in bulk to retailers in the area and the surrounding community.

loans.use: To purchase firewood stock for charcoal production.

loans.name: Mrs. Yoeurn Douk Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan includes twelve people who live in Sdok village in Takeo province. Mrs. Yoeurn D. is the village loan president who has been selected by all the members, who will each use their loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Yoeurn D. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Meng Che, owns a rice mill in the local village. The couple have 3 children, one of whom is an employee in a garment factory, while the other 2 are attending the local public school.

While the family works hard in their business, they would like to earn more income and improve their living conditions. Mrs. Yoeurn D. has therefore decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to re-sell.

loans.use: To buy more rice to re-sell

loans.name: Almada Group

texts.es:
Las mencionadas mujeres son de la Compañía Almada de la Ciudad de Caacupe. 

Son señoras  que trabajan en su mayoría como artesanas en sus propios hogares, realizan todo tipo de artículos  en goma como ser planteras, alfombras y muchos otros artículos, en temporadas anteriores al programa comité de mujeres ya trabajaban comercialmente pero en menor escala, por eso es que en estos días, al formar parte del programa de Comité de mujeres emprendedoras,  existe una actitud de sentido de pertenencia de las mismas para mantenerse al tanto de los requerimientos que les exige la fundación a modo  de que sigan siendo beneficiadas recibiendo un capital para satisfacer sus necesidades, invirtiendo en sus pequeños negocios que les generara más ingresos a la unidad familiar.Las mismas están agradecidas por tan valiosa oportunidad que les brinda la fundación, y esperan cada día capacitarse adquirir experiencias dentro del programa y cumplir sus obligaciones como socias.

Una de las socias es la señora Eliana V. quien posee un negocio en su domicilio ella se dedica a la atención de su negocio y a labores de la casa, comenta que la ganancia del su negocio ayuda para la alimentación de su familia, por ello quiere seguir trabajando y mantenerlo para continuar con esa ayuda tan importante para la familia.
El crédito que ella solicitó ló destino en la compra de artículos que ella vende en su negocio, en general todo lo referente a la canasta básica familiar.
texts.en:
These ladies are from the “Compañía Almada” in the city of Caacupe. Most of these women are artisans who work out of their homes. They make many types of rubber articles, such as planters, rugs, and many other things. Prior to their involvement with the women’s committee, they had been working at smaller scales. This is why, since they became part of the “Committee for Entrepreneurial Women,” there exists a sense of belonging and a desire to continue to fulfill the foundation’s requirements which allow them to receive capital to satisfy their needs and invest in their small businesses. The businesses brings income into their families. They are grateful for the wonderful opportunity that the foundation gives them and each day they hope to further themselves and acquire experience within the program and meet their obligations as associates. One of the associates, Eliana, runs her business out of her home and also attends to the household tasks. She tells us that the revenue from her business helps feed her family, so she wants to continue working and maintaining her business, in order to continue providing this important help to her family. She requested this loan to buy the items she sells in her business, namely all the basic foods a family needs.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, flour, pasta, baked goods, oils and dairy products

loans.name: Edlyn

texts.en:
Edlyn M. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old. Edlyn is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Edlyn owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Edlyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Edlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Edlyn is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Edlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Gabriel T. S.

texts.en:
Gabriel T. S. S. is a trader as well as being on the staff of the new Harvest Ministry as an evaluation officer. He sells and rents bridal dresses, ties, ladies’ bags and caps along Prince Williams Street, Bo.

Gabriel is married with two children and both are attending school. His wife assists him greatly at the shop when he is at work.

Gabriel has vast knowledge in business with about four years experience. He is seeking a loan that he will use to to acquire more stock for his shop and, as a result, cater to his customers' needs.

Gabriel intends to use the proceeds from the loan to start the construction of his house and cater for his children.

loans.use: To buy more ladies' wear and men's wear

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 70 years old and married with eight children, aged 14 to 47 years. Four of the children, including two grandchildren, are currently attending school. Paul is a farmer in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale. He has been farming for 46 years and has one employee. His main produce is maize, beans, watermelons, and cabbages, which he sells to the local market. Paul depends mainly on farming to educate the family and meet their needs.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 31,200 KES to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says that the income from this loan will help him meet the essential needs of his family, which are good health and education. His biggest challenge is the unpredictable weather conditions that affect his produce, and diseases like East Coast Rever that livestock are prone to in the area. In five years' time he would like to acquire more than 10 quality dairy cows.

He requests that "Juhudi Kilimo continue supporting the common man and maybe diversify its products to education loans."

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Tony

texts.es: Tony,de 20 años, es soltero y vive en una localidad ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, al lado de sus padres.Este joven a su corta edad ya tiene su propio negocio. En la actualidad ofrece servicio de reparación de artefactos  eléctricos, y tiene bastante experiencia en su labor , además considera que la  clave del éxito consiste en ofrecer repuestos de calidad y buen servicio hacia sus clientes, y  esta obteniendo buenas ganancias económicas . En cuanto al precio lo maneja de acuerdo al servicio de reparación que se requiera y su tienda esta localizada por la zona donde vive . En el futuro piensa  ampliar su negocio y adquirir una motocarro , con la finalidad de obtener un ingreso adicional. Por lo general trabaja solo y su horario  de trabajo empieza  desde las 7 de la mañana  y termina a  las 8 de la noche.Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y  se compromete a cumplir puntualmente con sus obligaciones de pago, además agradece a su banco comunal por la transparencia y apoyo que le brindan.Esta muy satisfecho con las reuniones mensuales con sus compañeros de grupo porque puede compartir sus experiencias.Tony tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de repuestos que tengan mayor demanda, con la finalidad de aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Tony, who is 20 years old, is single and lives in a town located in the beautiful Ayacuchan jungle, next to his parents. This man, at his young age, already has his own business. Currently, he offers an electrical repair service, and has a lot of experience with this. Additionally, he believes that the key to success lies in quality repairs and customer service to his clients, and he is earning good profits. He sets his prices according to the parts required for the repair, and his shop is located in the area in his neighborhood. In the future, he is thinking about growing his business and getting a motocarro (a motorized rickshaw) with the goal of earning even more. He usually works alone, with his schedule running from 7 in the morning until 8 in the evening. This will be his third loan with MFP, and he promises punctual payments. He would also like to thank his communal bank for the transparency and support it provides. He is very satisfied with the monthly meetings with his group of fellow borrowers, because its an opportunity to share his experiences. Tony has plans to invest the money in parts that are in greater demand, with the goal of increasing his income.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of electrical parts necessary to provide his repair services

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchasing wood planks [for resale]

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es: Leoncio, de 48 años, es un padre de familia muy amoroso y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Cristina de 49 años y sus 4 hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El cultivo de café y plátano es la actividad a la que se dedica Leoncio, todos los días desde muy temprano sale a trabajar a sus chacras, con el único fin de esforzarse mucho para que sus cultivos tengan muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, para evitar las plagas de sus siembras. Con el tiempo, espera sembrar más, de esa manera tener una mejor producción. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro aporte. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy cumplido y activo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más café, para ampliar sus actuales plantaciones.
texts.en:
Leoncio, 48, is a very loving and responsible father; he lives in his own house with his wife, Cristina, 49, and their four children for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Leoncio is a coffee and banana farmer; he goes out very early in the morning every day to tend to his fields his only goal being to do his best to insure high quality crops. What he enjoys the most about his work is cultivating the land; he has been in this line of work for 10 years and considers the most difficult part of it fumigating the fields to avoid pests. In time, he’d like to plant more so that production will be better. This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he realizes that he must make all his repayments on time if he wants to have access to future loans. He is a very trustworthy and active group member who plans to use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more coffee plants in order to increase the size of his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy additional coffee plants.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a 47-year-old married man living in Lebanon with his wife and their two children. He works in construction and has many years of experience. He works on a freelance basis, taking housing projects and other projects such as building shops.

After gaining a good reputation in his occupation, Salim plans to expand his work. That is why, today, he has requested for the first time a loan to purchase tools for his work and to pay for his children’s school tuition fees. He hopes to keep on improving and expanding his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work and to pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Luth

texts.en: Luth L., 35, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known as the most favorite tourist place in the country. L. raises pigs, earning an income of USD 150 per month. Her husband is a construction worker and earns an income of USD 7 per day. L. is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase pigs and a plot of farmland to expand the farming business. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. L.'s husband appears in the photograph because L. was not available.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Nazli

texts.en: Nazli S. is a 45 year old woman who has been engaged in farming and cattle breeding for the past 10 years. She is married and has three children. She and her husband produce seasonal fruits and vegetables and at the same time buy small cattle, fatten them, raise and sell them in the livestock bazaar. Nazli applied for 1000 AZN in order to purchase more cattle as this is the main financial source for her family.

loans.use: To purchase two cattle.

loans.name: Yav

texts.en:
Yav C. is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean temples. She is employed at a local garment factory for an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver and a farmer, earning an income of USD 3 per day.  C. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase cows to help plow the rice field. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s studies.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. C.’s husband appears in the photograph because C. was not available.

loans.use: buy cows to help plow the rice field

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila V. is from the village of Kiburiao, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Jamila is married and has two school-aged children. Jamila owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal products such as lotions and shampoos from different suppliers in the local community. Jamila has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Jamila joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Jamila is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jamila from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Eduardo Reyes

texts.es:
Eduardo de 33 años, tiene una tienda de víveres y  vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y comerciantes informales. 

Inicio su negocio con una percha de madera hace dos años, poco a poco fue incrementando su negocio con víveres para venderlo a sus vecinos. desde ese tiempo el dinero le ha ayudado a mantener a su familia. En la tienda vende arroz, azucare tc. 

El tiene dos hijos de 8 años y otro 8 meses y su esposa que viven en una casa que esta en construcción,  por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar un 50% cemento y pinturas y el otro 50% arroz y azúcar.  En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 33 years old and has a grocery store. He lives in El Fortín (a peri-urban area of Guayaquil), which is characterized by its dirt roads and informal merchants.

He began his business two years ago with a wood perch. Little by little, he expanded his business with groceries to sell to his neighbors. Since then, the money has helped him to support his family. In the store he sells rice, sugar, etc.

He has a wife and two children who are 8 years old and 8 months old. They live in a house that is under construction, which is why he wants to use 50% of the loan to buy cement and paint, and the other 50% for rice and sugar. In the future, he wants to better build his house to provide his family with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, oils, cement, paint

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: Georgina, de 54 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y amorosa, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Crisanto de 49 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente, Georgina ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado papa, maíz y habas, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo desea poner una tienda de abarrotes, las cual les pueda ayudar a mejorar su economía. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP, está muy feliz de poder acceder a este crédito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga el dinero que necesita. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará nuevas semillas para sembrar y abono.
texts.en:
Georgina, 54, is a cheerful, loving mother.  She lives in her own house with her husband, Crisanto, 49, and their four beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.

Working hard Georgina has managed to have her fields produce the necessary products to support her family.  Before the first rays of the sun appear she leaves her house and walks for about an hour to reach her fields where she has potato, corn and lima beans planted, products that she subsequently sells in Tarma’s wholesale market.

What she likes best about her work is tilling the soil because she feels she is putting it to good use.  She has been a farmer for 30 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting her goods to Tarma because the sacks she carries are very heavy and they tire her out. In time she’d like to set up a grocery store to better help her economy.

This is her 9th loan with MFP and she is happy to have access to this loan and wants to say thank you to all those who make it possible for her to have the money she needs.  In the communal bank she is a very respected member because of the order she imposes during meetings.

She will use the requested 3000 new soles to buy new seed to plant and manure.

loans.use: To buy potato and lima bean seed as well as sacks of manure.

loans.name: Huy

texts.en: Huy S. is 41 years old and lives with her husband and two of her children in the Prey Veng province. She sells groceries and works as a local doctor in the village and is able to make about $3 of profit every day. Her husband is a local teacher and he earns $2 per day. Since this family spends a lot on transportation costs, Huy S. would like to take out a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Chen's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of fourteen people located in Khmut village in Kandal province. Mrs. Chen V. is a 52-year-old married woman and has been  selected as the village bank president. Each member of this village bank will use their portion of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mrs. Chen V. and her husband, Mr. Chen Chim, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate rice. They are also able to have some income through their two children who are working as seamstresses in a garment factory. 

But now the family  faces a problem because their house is getting old, and they do not have enough money to fix it. Thus, Mrs. Chen V. would like to ask for a loan to add to her savings to fix her house up.

loans.use: To add to her savings to fix her house up

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe S. is from the town of Banga. She is 47 years old. Maria Fe is married and has three children, aged 24, 14 and 8. To make a living, Maria Fe owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Maria Fe wishes to have a better income to sustain her family's needs, especially her children's education.

Maria Fe joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies such as fertilizers. This loan will be Maria Fe's first loan from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies, such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina de 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 2 queridos hijos. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de abarrotería en general, aprovechando que tiene muchos años su tienda es muy conocida en la comarca de los hornos achuapa, ofreciendo a sus clientes productos que son rápidamente comprados, ya que ella sabe muy bien cómo convencerlos y alentarlos a que se lleven más de un solo producto. Este es el primer crédito espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a más créditos, pues siempre está al pendiente de los productos que solicita.
texts.en: Luz Marina, 30-years-old, is a simple, hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband and their two beloved children. She runs a general/grocery store. Due to the fact that her store has been around for many years, it's very well known in the area of Los Hornos Achuapa. She offers her customers popular items and she knows very well how to convince and encourage them to buy more than one product. This is her first loan and she hopes to be very punctual in making her payments because she wants to receive more loans. She always keeps her merchandise up to date.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Genelyn Dauag's Group

texts.en:
Genelyn D. is from the village of Linglingay, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 37 years old. Genelyn is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Genelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Genelyn owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Genelyn has been engaged in her business for over 14 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Genelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Genelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Genelyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Genelyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue she generates to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucy Wanjiru

texts.en:
Lucy Wanjiru K. is 33 years old. She is married to Benson Mwangi, who is a salesman. Together they have two children.

Lucy owns a retail shop, which is her primary business. She also runs a kerosene pump and manages rental houses in the Baba Dogo Estate, which is just a few kilometers from the Nairobi town centre. She has run her business for the last 11 years, with a maximum profit of Kshs. 8,000 per month.

Lucy is applying for her first loan of Kshs. 30,000 from KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a KADET client. With the loan, she plans to buy more stocks of food, more kerosene for sale, and complete some of the rental houses.

With the profit she anticipates to earn, she will complete construction of the rental houses and finish the houses with nice details. In the future, she hopes to build a home for her family and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of food, more kerosene for sale, and complete rental houses.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim S., 42, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for being the most populated city in the country. She sells fried noodles, earning an income of USD 17 per day. Her husband always helps her with this business. Each month, the family has to spend USD 130 on food, USD 15 on the children’s education, and USD 55 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new cart to improve her fried noodle-selling business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy a new cart to improve her fried noodle-selling business.

location.town: Mean Chey District, Phnom Penh City

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 43-year-old widow with two children aged 26 and 24. She is a hardworking woman who sells water to earn her daily bread. She also earns extra income from her rental houses. She was previously employed as a casual worker in a coffee-processing company.
Jane is a member of New Kujitegemea group in Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. She has previous benefited from the group because she has taken two loans through the group. This is because the group members guarantee each other's loan. She is also able to save her money on a weekly basis through the group. She has requested another loan, of 80,000 KES, to purchase a water tank and pipes. Jane hopes to improve her business in the future and become a well-known water vendor.

loans.use: To buy a water tank and pipes

loans.name: Chorn's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five members who are located in Tep Archun village in Kandal province. 

Mrs. Chorn P. was born in 1943 and is the group leader.  She was selected to be the group leader by the other members. She and her husband, Mr. Preap Kit, are farmers who own a 1.20-hectare plot of land on which they grow corn and rice. With this farming, they have not had enough money to increase the yield.  So Mrs. Chorn P. would like a loan to buy fertilizers, gasoline, and to pay for hired farming laborers to grow rice and corn. 

This couple has a child who is a wedding chef.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, gasoline, and to pay hired laborers for growing rice and corn.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph O. M. is 46 years old, married to Naipanoi M., and the father of seven children. For the last 11 years, he has farmed his own piece of land and earns a good income. Wheat has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions.


He learned about KADET LTD through posters. This will be his second loan. He plans to buy farm inputs and hire machinery for preparation of the land.  With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.


His future dreams are that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more wheat for commercial farming, buy his own farm machinery, and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and hire machinery for preparation of the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase good quality seed for his land.

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en: Kwekwe is a single woman with one child who is not yet old enough to attend school. For the last five years, she has operated a retail shop where she sells various items to her neighbors. She also sells charcoal, and dreams of expanding both of her businesses in the future. She has applied for this loan to buy wheat flour, maize flour and sugar to sell to her customers. She joined Yehu to get loans that will allow her to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Rosmery  Paola

texts.es:
Rosmery tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en general desde hace 4 años. Ella ofrece estos productos tanto al crédito como al contado y los ofrece principalmente entre sus vecinos y conocidos. Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y se vale de ella para ayudar al mantenimiento de su economía diaria.

Rosmery desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio aprovechando los costos bajos que le permitan incrementar sus ganancias, así también desea comprar los útiles escolares de su menor hijo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.
texts.en:
Rosmery is 26 years old, married and lives with her family in the district of Olmos, a highly commercial agricultural area located in the province of Lambayeque, over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been selling clothing for four years.  She sells her products on credit or for cash with her main customers being neighbors and acquaintances.  The business has been of great economic help to the family and helps cover daily household expenses.

Rosmery wants to buy more merchandise to expand business and take advantage of the low costs so she can increase her earings and buy school supplies for her youngest child.  She decided to request a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to help her reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de ropa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo porque al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía como es zapatos, ropa para niño, juguetes y aparatos eléctricos pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión que su negocio esta necesitando para tener mas ingresos a su familia ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las gana que obtiene del negocio ya que en el trabajan ella y su esposo.
texts.en: Magdalena has been selling clothes for over four years now.  She is asking for a loan because the business needs more variety of merchandise like shoes, children’s clothes, toys and electronics, but she lacks the necessary money for this investment that her business needs in order to have more family income since this is her only source of income.  She plans to repay the loan with part of her profits from the business since both she and her husband work at it.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Razel

texts.en:
Razel is married with 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Razel is 30 years old and has a child who is in school.

Razel has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Razel requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of vegetables to sell in her stall.

Razel has been in this business for 4 years.  In the future, Razel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell in her stall

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Married to Philip, Tabitha, a 43-year-old mother of four children, has practised farming in the town of Naivasha for the last four years. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of her friends, and this will be her third loan with which she will buy seeds and fertilizer for planting during this planting season. She repaid her previous loans well and in good time.

In the future, Tabitha hopes to practise large-scale farming and become a leading farmer in Naivasha.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna vive en nuevo Naranjo Municipio de Tecpatan estado de Chiapas México, ella es casada con el señor  Lorenzo y con quien procreo tres hijos y son: Meliara de diesi siete años de edad, María Dolores de quince años y el  más pequeño  es Adán de trece años.

   Ella se dedica a la compra y venta  de ganados, engordarlo y posteriormente venderlo, en la misma localidad, en esta actividad lleva tres años y comenta que le va bien ya que con  ello ha estado trabajando los un poco de los ingresos  que la da su esposo  ya que le se cuentra trabajando fuera de la localidad.

   Se inspiro en esta actividad ya que  también quiere apoyar a su esposo trabajando y juntos sacara adelante a su pequeña familia  que s lo mas importante para ellos  darle un bien estar mejor.
 
   Su deseo es que  con esta  actividad y el préstamo que solicito pueda incrementar más su actividad  y sus ahorros sea mejor cada día.
texts.en: Reyna lives in Nuevo Naranjo, municipality of Tecpatan, Chiapas, Mexico. She is married to Lorenzo, with whom she has three children: daughters Meliara, 16, and María Dolores, 15; and son Adán, 13. Reyna has made a living buying and selling cattle to fatten and then sell for the past three years and says that it is going well since she has given a little of the income to her husband, who is currently away working. She was inspired to start this activity since she wanted to support her husband and together make headway for the family since the most important thing is giving the children a better quality of life. Her goal is with the loan she can expand her business and her savings can grow every day.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten and later sell.

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en: Batchuluun is 41 years old and lives with her three children in a ger, Mongolian yurt, in Dornod province of Mongolia. Her older son is a student who helps with his mother's business during his vacation. She manages a clothing business at a rented stall at a trading center. She started her business in 2010 and is planning to expand her business in the future. Previously, she used to work at an ice-cream factory for several years and, because of a low salary, she had to quit her job. Now she sells all kinds of clothes, with a broad variety of design and style.  Her working capital exceeds 2,000,000 MNT. She is a hardworking and diligent woman who says, "I want my children to be educated and have better jobs in the future." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase clothes from China.

loans.use: to purchase clothes from China

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en: Gantumur is 48-year-old, divorced woman who lives with her two daughters who attend college. They live in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She manages a shoe trading business at a rented stall at Narantuul, one of the biggest markets in Mongolia. She started her business in 2008 and since then has been able to stabilize her business. Now her working capital exceeds 2,000,000 MNT. She earns 60,000 MNT monthly and purchases stock 1-2 times a month. She is a polite woman who says, "I want to expand my business." She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more shoes from Erlian.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes from Erlian

loans.name: Genalin

texts.en:
Genalin is 41 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Genalin works very hard to provide for them.

Genalin runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Genalin has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, seasonings, curls, and other groceries. 

In the future, Genalin would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Transito

texts.es:
Transito tiene 36 años de edad, es casada vive con su esposo e hijos de 16, 12, 10 y 2 años, en el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C ALLI KAUSAY, se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Tolapungo, sector Veintimilla, perteneciente al cantón Guaranda, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales, comercio de ganado, legumbres y otros.

Transito se dedica al comercio de legumbres, agricultura, crianza de animales, el esposo se dedica a la albañilería, tiene un medio solar, casa propia, siembra maíz, trigo, habas, papas, además tiene una vaca y un cerdo. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Guaranda.
 
Solicita el crédito para, compra de abonos e insumos  para los cultivos e incrementar su negocio. El  crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos el incremento y caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los bruscos cambios climáticos por los que estamos atravesando. Su sueño es ampliar su producción  y sacar a sus hijos adelante. 

Le gusta las fiestas, realizar actividades domésticas, pasear.
texts.en:
Transito is 36 years old, married, and she lives with her husband and her children, aged 16, 12, 10 and 2. They live in the canton of Guaranda in the Bolivar province.

The communal bank "Alli Kausay" is located in the community of Tolapungo, in the sector of Veintimilla. It belongs to the canton of Guaranda. The members of this group are dedicated to agriculture, raising livestock, and selling cattle, vegetables and other products.

Transito sells vegetables and she is an agriculturist as well as a livestock farmer. Her husband is a construction worker. They have a greenhouse, a house of their own, and they plant corn, wheat, fava beans, potatoes and they also have a cow and a pig. She busy and sells her products in the wholesalers market in Guaranda.

She requests a loan to purchase fertilizers and products for the cultivation to increase her business. The loan will help her to meet her financial needs and to improve her agricultural activities. She is faced with the variable prices of products that she sells, as well as the sudden changes in climate that we are experiencing. Her dream is to increase her production and to provide for her children.

She enjoys parties, house work, and traveling.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and products to improve her agricultural business.

loans.name: Mercedes Celina

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes tiene más de cinco años de manejar el negocio de pulpería, se ha dedicado a atender su negocio después de la muerte de su mama, Mercedes estudia en la universidad por las noches.
En su negocio de pulpería vende granos básicos como ser maíz, azúcar, frijoles, arroz, pollo, queso, mantequilla, artículos de limpieza, shampoo, jabón de baño y otros., sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que le visitan a diario y  desea invertir el credito en la compra de abarrotaría y refrescos.
Su mayor deseo es terminar la universidad y remodelar su negocio a corto plazo.
texts.en:
Sra. Mercedes has owned a general store for more than five years.  She has run the store alone since her mother's death.  She studies at the local university in the evenings.   
Mercedes sells everyday products such as maize, sugar, beans, rice, chicken, cheese, butter, cleaning products, shampoo, bath soap, etc.  Her customers are her neighbors and friends.  She will use this loan to buy grocery products and soft drinks that she will resell.
Her greatest hopes are to remodel the store, as soon as possible, and to finish school.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a married woman with four children all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past six years, she has operated a green grocer business, selling at the market and from home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of drought in her business. She dreams of establishing another shop in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) she wants to purchase sacks of green vegetables and fruits for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of green vegetables and fruits for sale.

loans.name: Raul Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en L. Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.
El socio Raul; tiene 34 años de edad,  el socio tiene 1 hijo de 8 años de edad; él socio se dedica al transporte, el tiene una unidad vehicular propia L. cual está en una asociación de transporte y presta el servicio de taxi desde hace 10 años, el socio requiere invertir el crédito en L. compra de llantas y el mantenimiento respectivo de sus unidad vehicular para que siga operando adecuadamente, el socio es  una persona muy trabajadora  y dedica L. mayor parte a prestar el servicio de taxi para de este modo construir su vivienda y dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familia. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en L. compra de llantas y hacer el mantenimiento de su unidad vehicular.
El socio agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Raul is a member of the "Solidaridad-Cachimayo" community bank which is located in Cachimayo district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Raul is 34 years old and has an eight-year-old child.  He works in the transport field.  He owns a vehicle which is registered with a transport association and has been providing a taxi service for ten years.  Raul needs to invest his loan in buying tires and having his vehicle serviced so that it will continue working properly.  He is a very hard-working person who spends most of his time providing a taxi service so that he can build his home and provide his family with a better quality of life.  He is requesting this loan to invest in buying tires and having his vehicle serviced.

Raul is grateful for the support that he is being given and pledges to make his repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying tires and to have his vehicle serviced

loans.name: Carlos Livigton

texts.es:
Carlos Livington tiene 43 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC Unión y Progreso la Colombia baja, esta conformada por quince integrantes y esta ubicada a 90 minutos de la cooperativa esta ventanilla se dedica a Actividades Agrícolas, siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz,Soya plátano, naranja, etc.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura, tiene cultivos de cacao arroz, maíz, soya, naranja, las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana .
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, abonos e insumos para los cultivos y tambien invertir en la compra de cerdos para la cria y luego venderlos.

Con la ayuda del prestamo le ayudará a suplir necesidades económicas, Enfrenta desafios que son muy frecuentes como la competencia y las plagas.

El sueño es poderse comprar una casa y más hectareas e terreno para aumnetar los cultivos y tambien los ingresos.
En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con los padres para que puedan distraerse.
texts.en:
Carlos Livington is 43 years old.  He is single and doesn't have any children.  He lives with his parents in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'Unión y Progreso la Colombia Baja' community bank has fifteen members and is located 90 minutes from our cooperative.  The members of this bank work in agriculture.  They grow cacao, rice, corn, soy, bananas, oranges, etc.

Carlos is a farmer who grows cacao, rice, corn, soy and oranges.  He makes both his purchases and his sales in San José del Tambo every weekend.

Carlos is requesting this loan to buy seeds, manure and supplies for his crops.  He will also invest in buying pigs to raise and then sell.

The support of this loan will help Carlos to financially cover his needs.  He faces very frequent challenges such as competition and pests.

Carlos' dream is to be able to buy a house and more hectares of land so that he can increase the amount of crops he grows and also his income.  In his free time, he enjoys going out for walks with his parents so that they can enjoy themselves.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure and supplies for his crops, and to buy pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Haguruka Dukore 13 B / Rsz Group

texts.fr:
Alexianne  fait partie du groupe Hagurukadukore 13 B. Le nom du groupe signifie « Avoir le courage de travailler». Il a 36 ans et il est marié avec 5 enfants de 6 à 16 ans, dont 4 scolarisés et avec une autre personne en charge plus que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est  3 ans de secondaire.

Alexianne est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utilisation de fertilisants pour augmenter la productivité du riz. Dans les prochaines années, Alexianne voudrait avoir un stock  de riz enfin de vendre beaucoup plus de riz dans sa région. Avec les profits, il prévoit d’éduquer et soigner ses enfants.
texts.en:
Alexianne is a member of the 'Hagurukadukore 13 B' group.  This group's name means 'Have the Courage to Work'.  Alexianne is 36 years old, married, and has five children between the ages of 6 and 16.  Four of her children are in school and she has one other dependent in addition to her children.  Alexianne completed three years of her secondary education.

Alexianne is a rice grower and this is her first loan cycle with ACB.  She will use her loan to buy chemical fertilizers for her rice crop.

Alexianne's strategy for growing her business is to use fertilizers in order to increase the productivity of her rice.  In the coming years, she would like to have a stock of rice so that she can sell a lot more rice in her region.  She plans to use her profits to educate and care for her children.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers for her rice crop

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 57 years old and is married. She has a small store where she sells both food and daily use products, such as soap, shampoo, biscuits and canned goods, to the people in her village. She had been in this business for almost five years and earns about P3,000 a month. She operates her store inside her house where she can comfortably meet her customers' demands, even though it is not a convenient place for them to buy.

She is now requesting for a loan of P12,000 to buy eggs, breads, shampoo and soft drinks to sell in her store. These items would help increase her sales and boost up her profits.

Rosie would like to earn more income and someday construct a store in front of her house.

loans.use: to buy eggs, breads, shampoo and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married, and lives with his wife.

Since 2006, Haydar has owned a shop selling knitting needles, tailoring accessories, buttons and fabrics. He has experience in this field. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there is a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $3000 loan in order to redecorate his shop and to add more stock. He aims to make more profit so he is able to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to redecorate his shop and to add more stock.

loans.name: Jose Cesar

texts.es:
Jose de 53 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Guasmo”, un hombre trabajador que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento de negocio.
Su negocio es un vehículo de transporte público, escogió esta actividad ya que desde pequeño le gustaban los vehículos.
Esta actividad la realiza solo, la ejerce todos los días de la semana desde las 5:00am hasta las 22:00pm.
Su dificultad es la delincuencia y la competencia.
Está casado, su esposa lo ayuda a él con los pagos de su casa, trabaja vendiendo ropa.
Tiene hijos de 19, 22, 26, ellos ayudan a su papa económicamente.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de llantas, radio, asientos y accesorios como la bocina del vehículo.
Su sueño es comprarse un vehículo nuevo y que a su familia no le falte nada
texts.en:
53-year-old José lives in a suburban area called 'Guasmo'.  He is a hard-working man who has aspirations to grow in his business.  His business is providing a public transport service with his vehicle.  He chose this business as he has always liked vehicles since he was a young boy.  He works every day of the week, from 5.00am to 10.00pm.  The difficulties he faces are crime and competition.  José is married and his wife helps him cover their household expenses by selling clothes.  He has three children, aged 19, 22 and 26, who help their father financially. 

José is requesting a loan to buy tires, a radio, seats and accessories such as a car horn.  His dreams are to buy a new vehicle and for his family not to want for anything.

loans.use: to buy tires, a radio and seats

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has three children; two of them are currently in school. For the past two years Christine has been working hard to manage her small business selling fish at the local market. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her fish purchases and will help Christine to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Christine's future prospects by helping her to improve her capital.

loans.use: to increase fish purchases

loans.name: Chrek

texts.en:
Chrek is 32 years old. She is a single parent, who lives with her two school-aged children in Ang Snoul district. Nowadays she works for a garment industry as a member of the sewing staff. She typically earns a monthly salary of $80. She always tries to work overtime to provide her two kids with basic living necessities. She is a really good mother, who cares for her children’s educations and future. 

Chrek is taking out this loan from Kiva partner HKL to buy a second-hand motorcycle for traveling back and forth to her workplace. In the future, she plans to save money in order to build an appropriate house for her children.

loans.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle for traveling back and forth to her workplace.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru:
Зарине 26 лет, замужем и воспитывает двоих детей.
Зарина родилась в селе Панфиловское, в простой семье фермера с 5-ю детьми. С детства она помогала матери по уходу за домом и младшими детьми. В 2002 году Зарина поступила в Архитектурный университет, где проучилась 5 лет и в 2007 году Зарина вернулась в родное село к своим родителям.
В 2008 году в возрасте 23 лет, Зарина вышла замуж. Год спустя, в 2009 году у них родилась первая дочь, а через год еще одна. 
В поиске источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2010 году Зарина с мужем решают приобрести торговый павильон в поселке Каинда. Вложив начальный капитал, молодая семья выкупила торговое место и закупила первую партию товара.  
В данное время, благодаря  трудолюбию и упорству Зарины, ее магазин приносит около 12,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зарина обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров.  Доходы она планирует вложить в пополнение товарных запасов и обновление торгового оборудования.
texts.en: Zarina is 26 years old, married and is raising two children.  She was born in the Panfilovskoye village, in a simple family of a farmer with five children.  Since childhood, she has been helping her mother with taking care of the house and the younger children.  Zarina was accepted into the Architectural University in 2002, where she studied for five years, and in 2007, Zarina returned to her parents in her native village.  In 2008, Zarina got married at the age of 23.  Her first daughter was born a year after that, in 2009, and then another daughter one year later.  In search of a source of income for her family, Zarina and her husband decided to purchase a retail space in the Kainda village in 2010.  Having invested an initial capital, the young family bought out the retail space and purchased a new inventory of merchandise.  At the present time, thanks to Zarina's love of hard work and persistence, her store yields about 12,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop her business, Zarina requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand the assortment of merchandise.  She plans to invest the profits into refilling her merchandise inventories and updating her retail equipment.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia is a 25-year-old married woman with three children, not in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for 3 years.

Nadia is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale

loans.name: Carmen Barbarita

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer con una alegría contagiante y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, sobre todo porque es madre de un hijo el cual ahora ya es mayor de edad pero por el cual ha luchado mucho para poder brindarle una buena calidad de vida y sobre todo mejores oportunidades.
